loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has been operating her own rental-housing business for years, simultaneous she had a variety store and she earns a decent income from this. She is from Malibay, Pasay City, and is 62 years of age.  

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Margarita would like to ask for another loan. An amount of PHP 50,000 would help her in the renovation and beautification of these buildings, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy more inventory for her sari-sari store business. She sincerely wants to let you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Margarita hopes that she will attract more boarders. She also desires to start up another business, for additional income.

Margarita meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her boarding house and sari-sari store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops in order to meet her client demands who have increased in the market.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en el 1er ciclo, es un grupo que está iniciando con muchas expectativas para poder mejorar sus vidas y también a la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las personas que se destaca es la Sra. Aracely, quien hace deliciosas comidas para la venta y después recorre por su barrio para poder venderlas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere poder capacitarse para que, a través de su trabajo siga dando a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para hacer sus comidas, es luchadora y a través del préstamo quiere crecer en el emprendimiento que tiene.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" ["Enterprising Women"] is in its first loan cycle. It is a group that is starting up with high expectations of being able to improve the lives of its members and their loved ones.

One member who stands out is Aracely, who makes delicious food to sell and then travels around her neighborhood to distribute it. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to receive training so that, through her work, she can continue giving her loved ones everything she couldn't have.

She is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make her food. She is a determined person who, with the help of the loan, wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa  tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo que vive junto a ella y su esposo. Por las condiciones de lejanía de su hogar y factores económicos solo accedió a la educación primaria sin embargo por experiencia adquirida sabe administrar su economía ya que desde muy joven incursiono en la agricultura de diversos cultivos como ser: cebolla, frejol, maní y zanahoria.
La señora Luisa es una persona muy responsable y muy querida en el lugar donde vive y trabaja. La comunidad donde trabaja es una zona de excelencia apta para la agricultura y los productos variados que cultiva son de mucha importancia para la alimentación y sustento de su familia y del lugar donde vende sus cosechas
En esta oportunidad la señora Luisa requiere un préstamo para la compra de semovientes (bueyes) para trabajar en con la yunta de bueyes en el preparado de sus terrenos,  de esta manera seguirá fortaleciendo su actividad de producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Luisa is 55 years old. She has 1 son who lives with her and her husband. Due to distance from her home and financial reasons, she was only able to get a primary education. Nonetheless, from her acquired experience she has known how to budget. When she was very young she started working in agriculture, growing diverse crops such as onions, beans, peanuts and carrots.

Luisa is a very responsible person who is beloved in the place where she lives in and works. The community where she works is an area that is excellent for agriculture and the different products she grows are very important to feed and sustain her family and those who live in the area where she sells her harvests.

At this time, Luisa needs a loan to buy livestock (oxen) to work with a yoke to prepare the soil. This way she will continue fortifying her agricultural activity.

loans.use: to buy livestock (oxen) to prepare the soil and improve agricultural yield and generate income for the family.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Selling goods and other various products is what Leoncia has been doing for many years from her sari-sari store to earn money to raise her five children. As a mother, she still provides for her children.  She is 48 years old.
 
Her customers in Batasan, Quezon City are already familiar with her credibility and quality service. However, it sometimes becomes a difficulty for her because of competition with the other sari-sari stores nearby. But Leoncia is not the type of woman to be easily defeated. 

To make her store a bit more attractive, she is planning to expand her business and add more product selection to her kiosk. She wants to borrow PHP 30,000 for this. This will surely help to make her sales increase. 

She also wants to thank those who have lent to her previously from Kiva. It was a great help indeed and she hopes that you will extend your helping hands again to her this time. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional packets of baking flour for preparing mandazis and chapati for sale

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 40 years old and married. He supports five children.

He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last four years, planting trees and earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his plants in order to meet his clients' demands.

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

He hopes to eradicate poverty and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his plants in order to meet his clients' demands.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines. Sari-sari means "variety". Since then, they provide the people with products mostly needed in everyday survival- from products for personal hygiene such as shampoo, toothpaste, powder; to condiments, foods, canned goods and other stuff at merely low-cost. This is why many of those who want to start a business often start with being Sari-sari vendors because in just a small capital, you can automatically operate a store and earn money.

Here is Amanda, 56 years old from Pasay City, Metro Manila. She began being involved in this kind of business 10 years ago. And through all those years, she was able to provide her children a living through the income she gets from the store. What she does is basically buy supplies in large quantity and then displays them at her store and sells them in retail, often for a price that is much more affordable for people but is larger than the original price so she can have a profit.

However, you cannot expect a regular and stable income from this since sales vary from time to time. For this reason, Amanda wants to ask you for a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy more supplies of products to display in her store. Certainly, this will really help her improve her business and attract more customers.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of merchandise products to display in her store.

loans.name: Sulani

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sulani. Sulani is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two sons and two daughters. Sulani has been an honorary teacher for 5 years and her husband has been employed for 4 years.  She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a sanitation at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water source for families. Her family income is still not able to build toilets and water sources with cash but they are able to repay loans received.

Sulani and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build sanitation at her home, to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Ruth Janeth

texts.es: La señora Ruth Janeth de 48 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno propio, tiene dos hijos que depende de ella, los cuales se encuentran estudiando uno en el nivel secundario y el otro en la universidad, tiene su esposo, viven en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Huacareta. Su principal actividad de la solicitante es la producción de miel de abejas. Es por eso que la señora Ruth Janeth requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de materiales y equipamiento para la apicultura, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de miel por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con su esposo e hijos ya que esta actividad requiere de menor inversión y menos trabajo una vez establecida la actividad
texts.en:
Ruth Janeth is 48 years old and lives and works in her home and on her own land. She has two children who depend on her and are currently in high school and college. She and her husband live in the department of Chuquisaca, in the town of Huacareta. Her main job is making honey from bees.

For that, Ruth Janeth needs a loan which will be used to buy the materials and equipment for beekeeping. Upon purchasing these, she will begin to work because she needs them to start the honey production. Therefore, she will be able to get a good income and improve the living conditions in her home and daily life with her husband and children. This job requires a small investment and less work once it is set up.

loans.use: to buy the materials and equipment for beekeeping, so she can improve honey production and get a better income for her family.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a 44-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Melisa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Melisa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Melisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a housewife, Helen wants to earn income while at home. She is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved her previous loan and for the lenders who helped financed her. The previous loan helped her to sustain her family’s essential needs, support her children’s education and add products for her business. While at home, she is selling grilled seafood.

Helen enjoys doing the business since it’s located in front of her house, where she can take care of her family as well. Aside from selling grilled seafood, she’s also planning to grill meat and chicken. That’s why she applied again for a loan of PHP 12,000 to have supplementary capital for the business. She’s hoping that lenders would once again consider her story as she prays that God will also provide blessings back to people with considerate hearts.

Helen is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and studies religion every week.

loans.use: to purchase fish, charcoal, and ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Eva is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Eva requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eva has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this activity.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her mama lishe stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as focused.

She operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital to enable her buy more stock.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to have a fully stocked business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon is a 34-year-old, married factory worker with two young children attending school. She has worked in the factory since 2014. Her husband is a 35-year-old motor-taxi driver. All of them live in Takeo Province in Cambodia. Both of them can make $15 per day.

In order to build up her family’s standard of living, Sinuon would like to access a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to run a public transportation business and make more income. Furthermore, she would like to run a small business, build a new proper house, and support her two young children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to run a public transportation business and make more income.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel. Although her family is not as as fortunate as other families, she and her husband, July, who is working as a driver, persevere and work hard for their children.

As of today, she is operating a small store of variety products along the road. Through this small stand, they are able to provide the family with the basic needs, though their income at times is still not enough.

Previously, she was granted a loan from Kiva that she used in filling her store with products. But that was a long time ago. Now, she still wants to further develop this so she could also increase her sales; and she asks help from you. She humbly wants to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to be used to buy more products to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this.

This is now your chance to help in just a little way. Every week, she joins a group of people that studies religion. There she is inspired and encouraged to go for living with hope and joy.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other supplies to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 59 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. He is a farmer who rears livestock and has been doing this for several years. He enjoys his business and it has been profitable.

This is his 5th loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to purchase additional livestock to rear and sell. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. With the anticipated income, Samuel will be able to repay his loan and purchase quality feed for his livestock.

His hope in the future is to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to rear and sell.

loans.name: Mohijon

texts.en:
Mohijon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She lives with her family in a small town. She works at a secondary school where she teaches history. The rest of her time she spends at home sewing traditional dresses for women. She gets orders at home. She also buys textiles and sews national tablecloths. She sells her dresses and tablecloths in the markets of the Sogd region. Her goods are different, with high quality and acceptable prices.

Mohijon is planning to buy new textiles for sewing traditional tablecloths and then to sell them. She appeals to IMON and Kiva for a loan to buy textiles.

She is waiting Kiva lenders kindness and support. Theoan will help her to do business and ensure her living with her family.

loans.use: to buy new textiles for her business sewing traditional tablecloths and then to sell them.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is currently managing a small embutido (a kind of processed meat) business together with his wife, Riza. It has been almost ten years now since they started this business.

Now, their business is gradually growing and they need enough capital to cater the demand of the customers. Therefore, Romeo would like to acquire a PHP 8,000 loan that will be used for buying more raw ingredients needed in making embutidos. This amount will serve as additional capital for their business expansion and he really hopes that you can help.

This means a lot to them; most especially that they will be able to gain a profit increase with this. Thus, they will be able to provide the family with better daily living, aiding with expenses and necessities.

One day in the future, he dreams of his business growing even more and having his own stall. He wants to give his family a successful life. He also prays that his family will also grow their faith in God.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the religion he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients needed in making embutidos.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emmalyn has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Emmalyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, Emmalyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo operates an "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is a combination of PC rental and arcade rental services wherein customers can pay the for services by inserting coins into the machine.

There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. His main patrons are students, who need his services for school requirements. He also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the Internet and use social networks. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

He is indeed grateful that Kiva helped him buy two more computer units for his business previously. Now he wants to continue the operations of his business, and therefore, he is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan.

He will be using the loan to buy three additional Piso Net units. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Romeo dreams to give his family a better and sustainable livelihood. Likewise, he also hopes his business will expand. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy two more units for his Piso Net business.

loans.name: Nghi

texts.en:
Nghi is a hardworking woman, 54 years old. There are five people in her family.

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standard.

Her family’s income is mainly from small business. With more than 20 years experience and support from her children, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Romih

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Romih. Romih is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has four daughters. Romih is a housewife and her husband has been a fruit seller for 5 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 IDR. This loan will be used to buy and build a sanitation facility at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water for her family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water sources using cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build sanitation facility at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Marta Liliam

texts.es:
Marta, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es maestro, tienen un hijo que está estudiando y vive con ellos.

Marta, tiene una venta de ropa y lociones desde hace 5 años, aprendió este trabajo cuando trabajo con una prima en su venta de ropa; tiempo después ella decidió colocar su propio negocio, su tienda de ropa la tiene en su casa, pero también sale a vender a otros lugares y su horario de trabajo es desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta que termina los pedidos.

El préstamo será para invertir en la venta de ropa y comprar camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y calcetines, para mejorar su condición económica.

Sus sueños son ampliar más su negocio y que su hijo termine los estudios.
texts.en:
Marta, who is 43 years old and married, studied until the end of high school.  Her husband is a teacher.  They have a son who is currently studying and who also lives with them.

Marta has had a business selling clothes and lotions for the past 5 years.  She learned how to run this business when she worked with a cousin in her business selling clothes.  Some time later Marta decided to put her own business together, she runs the stall from her home but also goes out to sell in other locations.  She works from 8am until the customers stop ordering.

The loan will be used to invest in the business by buying shirts, trousers, underwear and socks, to improve her economic condition.  Her dream is to grow her business further and for her son to complete his studies.

loans.use: to invest in her clothes selling business, by buying shirts, trousers, underwear and socks.

loans.name: Roxelia Maritza

texts.es: Roxelia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, refrescos y gallinas, desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y colocando puertas, pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para tener una vivenda digna.
texts.en:
Roxelia, age 39, lives in her own house with her family. She sells been selling tortillas, soft drinks, and chickens for several years. With what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She wants to improve her house by plastering the walls and installing doors. Because she does not have enough capital, she is requesting a loan. She will use the loan to buy doors, sand, and cement and to pay for the labor in order to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy doors, sand, and cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en:
Zipora is 28 years old, married and supports six children.

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last one year, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing and maize seeds to plant in order to meet the demnds of her clients, who have increased in the market, as well as feed her family.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

She hopes to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing and maize seeds to plant.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda would like you to know her full appreciation and thanks because her previous loan has indeed helped her in buying additional products for her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of 35,000 PHP which she had used in buying additional products for her inventory. 

But still, she would like to improve her sales more. For this, she is humbly requesting for another 30,000 PHP which she will utilize to purchase more merchandise. Preferably, her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

In some time in the future, she wants to renovate her house and be able to earn for her children's education. If they finish studies someday, it will be a great security for better lives ahead. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of supplies and products needed for her clothing business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old, married and supports four children .

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops as well as to buy maize seeds to plant.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

She hopes to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops as well as to buy maize seeds to plant.

loans.name: Josselin Yamileth

texts.es:
Josselin, de 23 de años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado y por falta de recursos económicos de sus padres no siguió estudiando, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, tiene un hijo que aún no estudia porque está pequeño.

Josselin, se ha dedicado a la comercialización de ganado desde hace 3 años, aprendió todo lo relacionado a la ganadería gracias a su esposo, el terreno donde tiene el ganado está a 20 minutos en bus y su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 a.m.

Josselin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca que le vende un familiar de él, con la ayuda de este préstamo mejorará su condición financiera, porque tendrá más ganado para vender.

Sus sueños son, tener más vacas para tener venta de leche y que su hijo comienze a estudiar.
texts.en:
Josselin, age 23, went to school through the eighth grade. Due to the lack of her parents' financial resources she did not continue on in school. She is in a relationship, and her husband works with livestock. She has a son, who is not in school yet because he is little.

Josselin has been selling livestock for three years. Thanks to her husband, she learned everything having to do with livestock. The land where she has the livestock is 20 minutes away by bus. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.

Josselin needs the loan to buy a cow that a relative is selling. With the help of this loan, she will improve her financial situation because she will have more livestock to sell. Her dreams are to have more cows in order to start selling milk and for her son to start school.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Niec

texts.en: Mrs. Niec is a hardworking woman who is 66 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and cultivation. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine to help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband and children, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, es un hombre muy tranquilo de cuarenta y seis años de edad, casado y padre de dos adolescentes. El dedica su día a día a enseñar a niños de la escuela primaria, tiene mucho tiempo siendo maestro. Poco a poco ha logrado realizar la construcción de un servicio higiénico que sera de mucha ayuda en la salud de su familia. 
Para seguir en la construccion del servicio higienico ha recurrido a un préstamo, de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar tarros de pintura, cemento, hierro, azulejos, arena, entre otras cosas. La construcción de este inodoro, ha sido su proyecto de los últimos meses, además ha mejorado notablemente la salud de su familia, dejar el uso de  letrina, también está contribuyendo a la no contaminación del suelo.
texts.en:
José is a quiet man who is 46 years old, married and father to two teenagers.  He spends his days teaching primary school children, he has been a teacher for a long time.  Little by little he has managed to build a toilet building which will be of great help to his family’s health.

In order to continue building the toilet he has requested a loan from Kiva in conjunction wih MiCrédito to buy tins of paint, cement, glass, tiles and sand, among other things.  The construction of this toilet has been his project for the past few months, it has considerably improved the health of his family to no longer be using a latrine, and the new toilet is helping to prevent soil pollution.

loans.use: to buy tins of paint, cement, glass, tiles and sand, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cashews.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!

This is Flordeliza. Flinging herself into managing her current sari-sari store business, she is hopeful that in no time she will be able to finally get her dream house and have more businesses as well. But as of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household.

Sari-sari stores are often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is mostly a convenience store, but smaller than the usual, and it offers only limited products that are commonly needed, such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Flordeliza had found ways to further improve her sales previously, and one of those is to have a loan from Kiva. It was a very good opportunity, and she was able to fully repay it.

Now, she would like to ask help from you again. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000, which she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for her family’s daily living condition. Today, you can be a big part of her life.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and toiletries needed to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Coconuts are native and abundant in the fields of the Philippines. This fruit is a very good source of various Filipino products. Because of its efficient use, coconuts are highly in demand in the market, whether as food or no.

Coconut is also a good ingredient of the delicious and affordable buko salad, so Jimmy has chosen this to be the object of his business. By now, he has been engaged in selling such for almost 10 years. He is 39 years of age and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines.

Seeking improvements, Jimmy is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan that he will use to buy additional stocks and supplies of raw ingredients for his buko salad business. This loan will be enough for him to improve his business, raise his sales and eventually save for his family’s future investments.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks and supplies of raw ingredients for his buko salad business.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 30 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Noeme has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Noeme requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Noeme has been in this business for five years. In the future, Noeme would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su esposa realiza los oficios de su casa, tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad que aún no estudia. 

Cesar, trabaja en limpieza y mantenimiento de piscinas desde hace 8 años, el dueño del lugar donde están las piscinas le tiene mucha confianza y es por eso que lo contrató para este trabajo, pero a parte de eso Cesar, tiene un negocio de venta de comida, el mantenimiento de piscinas lo realiza a 400 metros de su casa y viaja en moto, porque entra a trabajar desde las  7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:30 p.m. 

Cesar, necesita el préstamo para comprar verduras, condimentos y carnes para preparar los alimentos en el comedor, con este nuevo negocio que a implementado recientemente, pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Sus sueños son, que su hijo se prepare academicamente y se gradué de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 25, went to school through the ninth grade. He is in a relationship, and his wife does the household chores. They have a five year old child who does not yet go to school.

Cesar has been working cleaning and maintaining swimming pools for eight years. The owner of the place where the pools are has a lot of confidence in him. That is why he hired him for this work. Besides this work Cesar has a business selling food. The pool maintenance work he does is 400 meters from his house, and he gets there by motorcycle. He works there from 7:00 a.m. until 4:30.

Cesar needs the loan to buy vegetables, condiments, and meat to prepare the food at his eatery. With this new business, which he recently started, he plans to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

His dreams are for his to to be prepared academically and that he graduates with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, and meat in order to prepare food at his eatery.

loans.name: Lysette

texts.en:
Lysette is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her mother, a secretary, and six siblings. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because of its reputation as one of the best schools in Rwanda.

Lysette plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to either pursue an MBA, or work at a startup. At Kepler, she hopes to refine her skills in public speaking and leadership.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than is 59 years old and married with two children. She works hard to support her family. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family and also for environmental protection. Husbandry and small business are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. Two years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
Zeina is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her region. Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary food stuff (yogurt, groats, eggplant, etc...) to increase her production and satisfy her customers' needs.
Zeina hopes to open her own grocery shop in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary food stuff (yogurt, groats, eggplant, etc...) to increase her production

loans.name: Enaam

texts.en:
Enaam is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who are still attending school. In 2006, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. She cooperates with her husband to fulfill their family needs.

Today, she is asking to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase agricultural tools and seeds. She states that the loan will surely help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage, which will give her higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural tools and seeds

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Devota, who is in her late 30s single with two children, one of them is still in school and the other one is too small. She has been a tailor for five years now. She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Devota's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her sewing products, to buy more materials and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy nice materials for making good dresses and up to date suits. She dreams of expanding a tailoring business and be able to employ experienced tailor.

Devota will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to  buy nice materials for making good dresses and up to date suits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers for top dressing

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. He is in the transport sector via his motorcycle, and it has been profitable.

This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya to service his motorcycle as well as buy spare parts so as to improve its efficiency. With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to educate his children and diversify his business to farming.

His future hope is to educate his children, purchase food for his family and expand into farming.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle as well as buy spare parts so as to improve its efficiency

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Population grows from time to time. When numbers grow, the demand in the clothing industry also increases - a good opportunity for a dressmaker like Vivian.

For five years, it has been part of Vivian’s life to make clothes for sale. She is now 59 years old, residing at Malibay, Pasay City. Being skilled and experienced in this kind of livelihood, she has indeed earned a better income. Her craft has well supported her family to survive in their daily expenditures. Apart from tailoring, she also supervises a computer shop that has been developed recently through a loan she requested from Kiva.

Vivian would like to request a loan of PHP 40,000, which she will use to supply her business with enough threads, fabrics, and other materials, like another sewing machine. With this, she can generate more income for sure.

With full hope, she is aspiring that someday they will be able to have a comfortable life and that her business will soon experience a full blast. She is working very hard with immense passion that in no time all her hopes will get real.

Vivian meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to supply her business with enough threads, fabrics, and other materials to produce more clothes.

loans.name: Sataya

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Sataya works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising cow. Sataya is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Sataya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc for her business

loans.name: Adom Nnsa Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 49 year old man. He comes from Kokoben in the Ajumako Enyan Essiam District in the Central Region of Ghana. He is married with 6 children with their ages from 7, 12, 18, 20, 22 and 24 years. Only 3 of his children are attending school. Samuel is a wood carver and has been in this business for 20 years now.

He produces wood masks, sculptures, and wooden necklace and sells them in the local market. He also has a cocoa plantation which serves as his other source of income. His wife is also a trader who assists him in his business financially. According to Samuel, he learned the carving work from his father who was also a wood carver and he has been successful in it.

Samuel wants to expand his business and see it grow in the next 5 years by purchasing more materials for his work. But the source of fund to achieve this aim is his main challenge. Samuel needs a loan as a support to enable him achieve his aim. With the needed financial support to his business, Samuel will improve the lives of his children by financing their education. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy materials like polish, paints brushes for his work.

loans.name: Sirarpi

texts.en:
Sirarpi runs her clothing shop for 5 years. She lives with her elderly retired parents and is the main worker in the family.

Sirarpi sells a large variety of clothing in her shop and the loan to which she has applied for, will help to purchase new stock of school clothing to be prepared for the start of academic year.
Sirarpi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Please help Sirarpi to meet expected high demand and cover her customers' needs.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of school clothing to be prepared for the start of the academic year.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Indeed if you’re faithful to God, He will use people to direct and offer assistance. Clara’s variety store business is continually growing. She considers the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders participating in the Kiva program as God’s blessing to her. She’s delighted of having CCT since the prior loan of PHP 15,000 was granted, and the amount has been a supplementary capital for her business' growth. She was able to buy necessary items for the business to become more attractive to customers.

Competition in this line of business is what challenges her. Proper marketing strategy and the good treatment of customers are the qualities that she has. For 15 years until now she has had the business, and it’s still growing. Clara is able to support her children’s education because of her diligence and determination.

However, she’s not satisfied about the recent status of the business, since as an entrepreneur you should always think of ways on how to step up. She applied for another loan of PHP 15,000, as she wants her business to be a one-stop shop of dry goods. She’s hoping that her request will be granted as added capital for the business.

Clara regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
The food business nowadays is rampant, since whatever one does - celebrate occasions, make small talk, hang around with friends - one eats. That’s why wherever one goes, there are food establishments where one may find a wide variety of choices.

Flora has a passion for cooking, and that’s why she chose to sell viands for breakfast, lunch and dinner. She wants to thank lenders, Kiva and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for allowing her to have supplementary capital for her mini food stall business. She used her previous loan to buy ingredients and other equipment needed for the business.

The food business that she has right now is the source of her daily expenditures. She aims to save money for her family’s future and to have investments someday. Flora decided apply for a PHP 12,000 loan this year to buy grocery items to be used for the business.

Flora believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group meeting for CCT partners consisting of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed in her business, such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is grateful for the previous loan that was approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She wants to thank all of the lenders who are continually participating in the Kiva program, since the amount they provided really became a medium for the business to have an increase in sales. Without the help of the lenders, CCT, and Kiva, she didn't know how to restock products for her variety store. She didn’t have capital that she could use. Indeed, if you have faith in God, He will use people to answer your prayers. Once again, she wants to thank you all, dear lenders.

Alejandra is earning about PHP 2,500 each day and aiming to have a bigger store some day, where she can offer complete products to customers. She applied for another loan of PHP 50,000, as she wants to stock grocery items like toiletries, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments, and snacks. She believes that this will be the start to having her prayers answered. She wants to thank all of the lenders who will read her story.

Alejandra is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. Here, she gains spiritual strength for her life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hears God’s word.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gemma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 36 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 1 year. Asma's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose.

Therefore Asma has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is 39 years old. There are seven people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income sources. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education from pig-raising income.

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.

She has daily income from her garden such as vegetables, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Araceli has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more coffee and sugar for her cafeteria.

Araceli has been in this business for three years. In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and sugar for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is single with 2 school age children. She is 39 years old from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She runs an internet cafe and a sari-sari store (convenience store) just outside her residence. Her business were financed by Paglaum MPC.

Recently, she took a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to but new computer for her cafe.

loans.use: to buy another computer for her internet cafe

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Margarita Guadalupe

texts.es: Margarita de 34 años de edad vive en casa en propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, chicharron, quesillo, frijoles, entre otros ingredientes para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 34 years old and lives with her family in their own home. She earns a living selling tortillas and "pupusas" (stuffed corn tortillas). She has been doing this for 5 years and her business is located in her house. She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, fried pork rinds, fresh cheese and beans among other ingredients to be able to generate better income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fried pork rind, fresh cheese and beans among other ingredients.

loans.name: Njangutiti

texts.en:
Njangutiti is 30 years old and is married with three children. For the past five years, he has run a profitable livestock business. 

Njangutiti is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase goats and sheep. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children. Njangutiti’s hope and dream for the future is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns a food stall in Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She has been operating the business for almost 15 years now. She has four kids and is married to Wilfredo. Whatever income she gets basically from her chosen trade; she uses it for helping her husband in sustaining the family expenses.

Filipinos are fond of eating heavy meals. Unlike some foreign countries that are only used to eating breads for lunch or dinner, most Filipinos can’t afford to not eat rice with dishes during lunches and dinners. And it is a big help to most when there are food stalls along the roads where they can eat without even going home to just merely cook. This is the reason why perhaps Sarah has chosen to manage a food stall then. Since food is always in demand, she earns good profit from this.

However, Sarah still wants to expand her business, though she had already availed herself of a loan from Kiva previously, which was used for business purposes also. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 10,000 now. She will use this to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes. She wants to give to you her sincerest thanks for your goodness and generosity by now.

In the future, she wants her family to experience progress and improve, as well in her current business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of raw ingredients needed for her recipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Chona is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Chona has a food vending business in the Philippines. Chona requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Chona has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Chona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rhoda May

texts.en:
Rhoda May is 32 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school.

Rhoda May is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Rhoda May has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rhoda May would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur with five children.

Gemma has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as embroidery.

Gemma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Menche

texts.en:
Menche is 35 years old and has five children. Menche is married and has five children who are in school.

Menche is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Menche requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Menche has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Menche would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 67 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up under difficult circumstances, living with her aunt and sister in Uganda. Because of her tremendous academic performance and hard work, she was selected from over 6,000 applicants this year. Linda chose Kepler because of the job related skills and internships it offers to students.

Linda plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to pursue additional education and work in a communication company.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Dien

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, 56 years old, is a hardworking woman and has four children. They are the driving force of her life and the reason why she works so hard in her business. She specializes in cows, a job that she’s been doing for more than 25 years.

She wants to stock up so she can increase her profits and let the business be more successful; that’s why she wants to buy more calves that will let her increase her inputs of her work. She wants to see her work be sustainable over time, so she’s willing to invest more in her business. Someday, she expects to pay for her children’s education because she believes that is the way to do better in life.

loans.use: to buy more calves that will let her increase her inputs of her work

loans.name: Chhai Ya's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Thom province, Chhai Ya is 32 years old and a mother of three dependent children. One of her children is in school, while the other two are too young to go to school.

Chhai Ya can earn income to improve her family’s living conditions by growing rice on 0.5 hectares of farmland and working for others for a fee to get extra income. She has been involved in her rice farming for years, and it earns her about 9 USD per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living standard and health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family's living conditions and protect her children from illness.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children, some of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life and until now he barely earns a fair income.

For that reason, today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register her children with the coming school year. That makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid 40s, is divorced with three children who are still at school. She has been a tailor for nineteen years now. She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma’s 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to improve her business by buying good materials for making better dresses and good suits. She also bought sewing products and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She will use this buy up-to-date materials for making better dresses and suits. She dreams of expanding her business.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Mafanikio which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date materials for making better dresses and suits.

loans.name: Reynadith

texts.en:
Reynadith is married with two young children. She operates a habal-habal, a two-wheeled motorcycle that carries about six passengers, to provide transportation from one place to another in remote areas. Aside from this, Reynadith also sells balut, a boiled fertilized duck egg that is eaten in the shell and is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines. 

Reynadith is requesting a loan to buy stocks of balut and pay for motorcycle maintenance. Her loan will help boost her livelihood and increase her earnings. She also will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets. In the future, Reynadith wishes to uplift her family’s livelihood to have a better living standard.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and buy balut

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with five children.

Julius has had a farming business for ten years.

Julius has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase farm inputs.

With the anticipated profits, Julius will be able to pay school fees for his children.

His hope and dream for the future is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 70-years-old and married with six children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a junk shop.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marina Adelaida

texts.es:
Marina, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado bovino, tienen un hijo en común de 5  años de edad.

Marina, es dueña de una tienda que tiene en su casa, en donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, jabones para lavar ropa, detergentes, etc; decidió colocar la tienda porque su casa se encuentra ubicada en la calle principal del municipio donde vive y es una zona de mucho transito de personas y vehículos.- Su compañero de vida en algunas ocasiones le ayuda a atender en la tienda, cuando ella sale; el horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m.

Marina, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su tienda como: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, entre otros y de esta manera espera tener productos disponibles para sus cliente.

Marina, sueña con darle una buena educación a su hijo y todo lo que él necesite.- También desea incrementar el inventario de su tienda y poder obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina is 34 years old and went up to the ninth grade in school. She has a life partner whose occupation is buying and selling cattle. They have one son who is five years old.

Marina owns a store she runs out of her house where she sells all kinds of basic goods such as drinks, basic grains, snacks, laundry soap, detergents, etc. She decided to open the store because her house is located on the main street of her town and there is a lot of pedestrian and vehicular traffic there. Sometimes her life partner helps her tend to the store when she has to go out. The store is open from Monday to Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Marina needs the loan so she can buy more products for her store such as drinks, snacks, and basic grains, among other things, so the products her customers want will be available.

Marina's dream is to give her son a good education and everything he needs. She also would like to increase the inventory in her store so she will have more income.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store such as drinks, snacks, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Mangtup

texts.en: Mangtup is a Babban Gona farmer from Rika Vilage. Mangtup joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mangtup will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Mangtup would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fresh and dried fish.  Susan is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing needs like gasoline, wood, fishing net, etc for her fishing business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing needs like gasoline, wood, fishing net, etc

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her father and two brothers in Rwanda's capital of Kigali. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Liza chose Kepler because it offers the ability to pursue several internships over the course of study.

Liza plans to major inCommunications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to work as a social and economic entrepreneur, providing her community with additional employment opportunities.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Edith, holding the piece of paper in the picture above, is the president of Duteraninkunga Group. She has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2008 to develop her business, and is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

Edith is a 37-year-old married mother of four children between 8 and 18 years of age. She has owned and operated an agriculture business selling rice for the past five years, an enterprise that requires her to work from 6 a.m. until 12 p.m. every day, and still manage her household.

Edith has requested a Koramuhinzi loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. The Koramuhinzi loan product is a pre-harvest loan where the borrower will not be required to pay off the principle until after the harvest. This loan will allow Edith and her family to maintain their current standard of living until proceeds from the harvest arrive. With the pre-harvest funds, Edith will be able to pay her children's school fees and provide family support until her crops are ready to sell. She intends to use the profits from her harvest to save for the future.

The other members of Duteraninkunga Group have similar business, requiring an influx of funding to continue the success and expansion of their businesses. The average loan size in this group is 162,000 RWF.

loans.use: to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells water melons and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fruits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land for investment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kagashe Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Kagashe tukwatanise group is located in Rukungiri district, bugangari Sub County, katabushera. The group is comprised of only men whose major activity is agriculture. Richard is a married man aged 49 years and a father of five children, all in school. Richard is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and raises goats and chicken.

He recently applied for a loan of ugx1,000,000 through the group so that he can buy manure for his banana plantation and the balance he can invest it in goat rearing. This he is confident will boost his productivity and sales, bringing him more income. The entire group applied for a loan of 5,000,000 from UGAFODE and they are particularly very appreciative to the institution for the financial support they are providing.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his banana plantation

loans.name: Nuvia

texts.es:
Nuvia, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la agricultura, tienen 1 hijo en común de 6 años de edad; Nuvia, vive en casa de su mamá y en la misma casa viven varios hermanos de ella, los cuales también trabajan en labores agrícolas.

Nuvia, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, principalmente maíz, está actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años, cuando aprendió de su difunto padre.- La distancia que camina para llegar hasta el terreno donde tiene sus cultivos es corta.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, pago de jornaleros y preparación del terreno donde cultiva.

Nuvia, sueña con tener una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para su familia, además de poder darle una buena educación para su hijo.
texts.en:
Nuvia is 22 years old and studied up to the ninth grade in school. She has a life partner whose occupation is farming and raising pigs. They have one son who is six years old.

Nuvia lives in her mother's house and so do several of her siblings who are also farmers. Nuvia grows basic grains, mostly corn. She has been doing this for many years, a trade she learned from her father who has since passed away. Nuvia does not live far from the fields where she grows her crops. She needs the loan so she can buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and manure, to pay day laborers, and to prepare the soil for her crops.

Nuvia dreams of having a dignified, comfortable and safe house for her family and also to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and manure, to pay day laborers, and to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Kima

texts.en:
Kima is from Hrazdan town where she runs a shoe store. She sells different varieties of shoes in the center of Hrazdan. She lives with her husband and two children and her husband helps with the retail business.
Kima now asks this loan to purchase a new stock of autumn collection of shoes to cover the current demands of her customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

So, the support of lenders is very important for Kima to invest in her business and develop it.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of autumn collection of shoes, to cover the current demand of her customers.

loans.name: Thin Paung Chaung Village Group

texts.en:
Khin is 33 years old and is married with a kid who is in primary school. She is Burmese and from Thin Paung Chaung Village. The village is near the Myanmar delta, and since it's near river, the main businesses are farming and livestock. Khin’s husband works as a farmer every day and she helps him at harvest time since they get totally busy. Mostly, she takes care of the livestock and household chores. Khin is a member of the Thin Paung Chaung Village Group. 

Khin will use her portion of her group loan through Proximity to purchase more ducks. The Thin Paung Chaung Village Group loan will support 26 members and households to purchase ducks and quality feed. If the ducks are well fed and cared for, they will lay more eggs to help families boost their income. Pictured above are group members Khin, Hla, Nan, and San. 

Khin and her husband both hope for their businesses to run smoothly and increase in the future. After covering her family’s living expenses, Khin hopes to save for her child’s education through graduation.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and feed

loans.name: Kahengye Group

texts.en:
Kellen is in the right of this group photo. She is married to Aclergy and has five children who are no longer going to school. She is from Kebisoni town in the Rukungiri district. Kellen is a member of the Kahengye group, located in Kahengye town. She is hardworking and runs a business selling second-hand clothing.  Kellen has relied on her business to provide for the financial needs for her family, but her business alone cannot meet all of her needs, including the cost of living that has become high in Uganda. 

Kellen is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan with the Kahengye group to buy more second-hand clothing to sell and earn a profit. This will be her second loan.
