Kellen has been a member of Ugafode for the past five years to access financial assistance. She is hopeful that her dream of expanding her business will be achieved. The group praises Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled them to educate their children and maintain their businesses.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has five children ranging in age from 7 to 19. He describes himself as innovative. For six years, he has operated a food stall where he cooks cassava and potatoes to sell. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anointing Group

texts.en:
Anointing Group was started in the year 2009 at Chorkor, Accra-Ghana. These are four active, self-dependent members, with an objective of developing their businesses as well as their livelihoods. Each member of this group has his/her own profession and business. They sell shirts, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish, groceries, call credits, and general goods.

Mary is one of the group members who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ improvement. She is standing at the left in the photo. She is about 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children.

She has been engaged in a business making kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish in her own home for 21 years. Her husband also supports her business when he is not going to work. Through this business, she earns a good monthly income. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to pay her family's expenses. She joined a group designed to strengthen social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of their businesses.

Mary plans to purchase corn paste, fish, oil, and firewood to prepare kenkey and fried fish, which she will sell to her customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion. She also wants to save money to expand the business, and to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn paste, fish, oil, and firewood to prepare kenkey and fried fish, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her employee's motorcycle and fill empty gas cylinders.

loans.name: Reina Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen tres hijos, su hijo mayor le ayuda a su padre en las labores agropecuarias, cultivando granos básicos como maíz y maicillo, asi como también en la crianza de ganado bovino. 

Leticia, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, ella ordeña 12 vacas al día y obtiene un promedio de 100 botellas de leche al día, las cuales vende a otras personas, dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres, ella se encarga de comprar todo lo necesario para el ganado, como alimento y medicinas, así como también esta pendiente de darles de comer a tiempo y no descuidarse para que no se enfermen.- Leticia, tiene que viajar aproximadamente tres kilómetros para llegar hasta el lugar donde comercializa sus animales.

Ella. Necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla y comprar alimentos para su ganado, esto le servirá para obtener más leche y poder venderla para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Leticia, sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que sus hijos se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Leticia studied up to the fifth grade. She is currently married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children, the eldest of whom helps his father with the farm work growing basic grains such as corn and sorghum and also with raising beef cattle.

Leticia's occupation is raising beef cattle. She milks 12 cows per day and gets an average of 100 bottles of milk daily which she sells to other people. She learned this trade from her parents. She is responsible for buying everything they need for the cattle such as feed and medicine, as well as feeding them at the correct time and not neglecting them so they don't get sick. The place where she sells her animals is about three kilometers away.

Leticia needs the loan so she can buy a heifer and feed for her cattle. This will allow her to produce more milk for sale and increase her family income. She dreams of giving her family everything necessary to live well and for her children to be prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a married man. He has two children who are four and seven years old. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells buckets. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of buckets. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of buckets

loans.name: Angelis

texts.en:
Angelis is 38 years old, married with four children.

Angelis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Angelis has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from buying and selling school supplies.

Angelis aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. Teresa is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing nets and gasoline.

Teresa has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of fishing nets and gasoline.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit brings different food products (oil, sunflowers, chips) from a neighboring country to sell. He owns a garage and sells the products mostly to the shops in Eghegnadzor town. 

He requests this loan to purchase new stock of products to sell. As this is Davit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The loan will greatly assist Davit in continuing his business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of products to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with six siblings in a rural town in southern Rwanda. Because of his dedication and impressive academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Jean chose Kepler because it offers the skill training and support not available elsewhere in Rwanda.

Jean plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to own his own business, possibly in the field of transportation.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a Babban Gona farmer from Makwala Vilage. Naomi joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Naomi will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds.

This loan will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. Given this opportunity to earn high yields and increase her net income, Naomi would like to use her extra earnings to build a house/renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Kossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans. Kossiwa réside à Baguida et est une marchande de produits alimentaire. Kossiwa achète ses marchandises au marché et les revendent dans sa boutique à domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs  de détergents, des cartons de savons et des sachets de pure- water. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Kossiwa va pouvoir aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et dans les charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Kossiwa is a married woman aged 29. She lives in Baguida and sells grocery products. She buys her supplies at the market and resells them in her little shop in her home.

Kossiwa is requesting this loan to order some sacks of detergent, cartons of soap, and bags of Pure Water. With the profit she will make, Kossiwa will be able to help her husband with educating her children and covering the daily expenses incurred by the family.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of detergent, five cartons of soap, and 35 bags of Pure Water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, candy, among others.

loans.name: Rudy Alexander

texts.es:
Rudy, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su casa viven dos tíos los cuales trabajan en labores agrícolas, cultivando granos básicos como maíz y maicillo.

Rudy, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, él ordeña 2 vacas al día y obtiene 18 botellas de leche, las cuales vende a otras personas, dicha actividad la aprendió con sus padres, él se encarga de comprar todo lo necesario para sus animales como alimentos y medicinas.- Rudy, tiene que viajar aproximadamente tres kilómetros para llegar hasta el lugar donde comercializa sus animales.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla y comprar alimento para sus animales, esto le servirá para obtener más ingresos en su familia.

Rudy, sueña con tener una vivienda propia para tener mejores condiciones de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Rudy studied up to 4th grade. His partner takes care of the housework. Two uncles live in his house, who work in agriculture, growing basic grains such as corn and sorghum. Rudy works raising cattle. He milks two cows a day and gets 18 bottles of milk which he sells to other people. He learnt this trade from his parents. He is responsible for buying everything necessary for his animals such as feed and medication.

Rudy has to travel approximately three kilometres to reach the place where he sells his animals. He needs this loan in order to buy a heifer and feed for the animals. This will help him to increase his family's income. Rudy's dream is to have his own home and have better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and animal feed.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells mobile phones, chargers and other phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are locals. 

Damaris describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of phones, chargers and other accessories. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add even more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phones, chargers and other accessories

loans.name: Dúo San José De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Dúo San José de San Bartolo Éste Dúo está  liderado por  la señora Nora Lizeth quien se dedica a la venta de productos desechables (platos, bandejas, cucharas, tenedores, servilletas, jabón, detergente, desinfectante.  Éste negocio lo tiene desde  hace 10 años y ella menciona que gracias a Dios le va bien  y ya tiene clientes fijos a los que les hace entrega de sus productos por cantidades  mayores.  Ella  es una  mujer emprendedora  y  se ha dado cuenta que en el sector donde ella vive, el servicio de molino de nixtamal es escaso por lo que en esta ocasión ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de un molino nuevo de nixtamal para poder atender esa necesidad que existe en su comunidad.  Ella menciona que su meta es apoyar  a su hija que actualmente estudia  y agradece el apoyo que ha tenido de FAPE y de KIVA  ya que de esa manera ha podido ir mejorando con su familia.
texts.en:
The San José de San Bartolo Duo is led by Nora Lizeth, who works in the sale of disposable items (plates, trays, spoons, forks, napkins, soap, detergent, disinfectant). She has had this business for 10 years. She says that thanks to God, things are going well, and she has regular clients to whom she sells her products in wholesale quantities.

She is an entrepreneurial woman and has realized that in the area where she lives, grain mills are not widely available. For this reason, she wants to invest the loan in the purchase of a new grain mill in order to meet this need that exists in her community. She says that her goal is to support her daughter, who is currently studying, and she is grateful for the support that she has had from FAPE and from Kiva, since this support has allowed her to continue improving with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a grain mill to make flour, and to purchase disposable items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, baked goods, dairy products, fruit, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Nivonirina

texts.fr:
50 ans, mariée, Nivonirina est mère de trois enfants. Ces derniers ont 9, 16 et 17 ans et ils sont tous actuellement scolarisés. Le mari est secrétaire dans le bureau de leur quartier avec un salaire très faible et dérisoire.
Donc, pour pouvoir entretenir et soutenir la famille et surtout ses enfants, Nivonirina décidait, il y a maintenant environ 4 ans d'exercer une activité de commerce, elle dirige un magasin général avec gargote. C'est une femme courageuse et débrouillarde. Elle a un objectif dans la vie: avoir une vie meilleure. Elle travaillait dans une entreprise avant, mais son salaire aussi était très faible et en plus elle n'avait pas le temps de s'occuper un peu de ses enfants et de son ménage. C'est la raison pour laquelle, elle décidait de changer d'occupation et exploiter son propre affaire.
texts.en:
Fifty years old and married, Nivonirina is the mother of three children. They are 9, 16, and 17 years old and all are presently enrolled in school. Her husband works as secretary in an office in their dictrict with a laughably minimal salary. So, in order to support the family, and above all raise the children, Nivonirina decided four years ago to open a commercial business. She has a general store and cafe, and she is a courageous and resourceful woman. Her one objective is to have a better life.

Nivonirina also worked in a company earlier on, but her salary also was minimal and moreover, she did not have time to take care of the children and her household. This is the reason why she decided to change occupations and run her own business.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of flour, coffee beans, sugar, edible oil, pasta, etc

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, es madre soltera, porque su pareja murió hace varios años y junto a el tuvo tres hijos que en ese entonces estaban pequeños, ahora ya están grandes y dos de ellos ya trabajan y el ultimo estudia.

María, se dedica a vender pupusas por las tardes y tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 
varios años, cuando su pareja murió sus hijos estaban pequeños y ella no tuvo ayuda de nadie para sacar a sus hijos adelante, es por eso que decidió colocar la venta de pupusas.

El préstamo lo solicita para hacer una galera para elaborar las pupusas, para que cuando llueva no se moje ni ella ni sus clientes.

El sueño de María, es concluir su proyecto y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 49, studied up to 8th grade. She is a single mother as her partner died several years ago. Together they have three children who were still young at the time. Now they are older and two of them are already working and the youngest is studying.

María works selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) in the afternoons and she has also had a shop for several years, where she sells basic necessities. When her partner died her children were young and she had no help to get her children ahead. This is why she decided to start selling pupusas.

María is asking for a loan in order to make a shelter where she can make pupusas, so that when it rains she and her customers stay dry. Her dream is to finish this project and continue supporting her children so that they can continue studying and find good jobs.

loans.use: to make a shelter where she can make pupusas.

loans.name: Edgar Adalberto

texts.es:
Edgar, ha tenido una cosecha favorable de granos básicos, lo cual es posible porque el crédito anterior le dio los recursos económicos para realizar sus actividades agrícolas en el mejor tiempo, su situación económica es favorable, con ello la tienda de consumo está más surtida y cubre los gastos familiares.
Su deseo por seguir superándose hace que solicite un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, también adquirirá golosinas, arroz, aceite, condimentos, bebidas, etc., para surtir el inventario de la tienda, espera mantenerse trabajando para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edgar has had a favorable harvest of basic grains which was possible due to the previous loan which gave him the economic resources to carry out his agricultural activities in good time. His economic situation is good, his food store is well-stocked and covers the family's expenses.

His desire to continue to excel has him requesting a new loan to buy agricultural inputs to grow basic grains and also acquire sweets, rice, oil, condiments, soft drinks, etc. to stock the inventory of the store. He hopes to continue working to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting his crops and hire labor to prepare the ground for the next sowing season.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has five children. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Collins will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock and invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old. He is married with five children.

He has had a mining business for 13 years and it has been profitable. He has requested a loan that he will be using to purchase tools like a chisel, hammer, and some nails to help in his work.

With the anticipated profits, Peter will be able to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to diversify into starting a new business.

loans.use: to purchase tools like a chisel, hammer, and some nails to help in his work.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza and her family are very poor. In the photograph are Mimoza and her husband, Shkelqim, with their two younger children. Mimoza is 39 and a mother of three, with the oldest one being 12 and the youngest 8. She and her family live in a suburb under very unhealthy conditions, lacking sanitation and hygiene and sometimes staple food, according to Mimoza and the observations made by the loan officer who visited the family.

In addition to doing agriculture/livestock for a living, their family of eight receives some disability income as well for Mimoza's husband, mother-in-law and sister-in-law, who were born with disabilities.

This family needs your compassion and understanding. They need to build a little room and a toilet because they are very crowded inside their very little home.

loans.use: to build a room and a toilet.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, tuvo 11 hermanos y debido a que sus padres no podían mandar a la escuela a todos ninguno estudio, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales ya tienen sus familias, ella cuida dos nietos que están estudiando.

María, hace tortillas desde 1982, conoce bien ese negocio, pero además hace tamales de elotes; anteriormente hacia pupusas también, la ventaja que tiene es que el negocio está en su casa, su pareja le apoya en todo el que hace.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para hacer las tortillas, porque debido a la sequía no habrá cosecha de maíz y lo venderán más caro.

En un futuro María, desea que sus tortillas se vendan no solo en su colonia, si no también en otros lugares.
texts.en:
María, 56, had 11 siblings. Their parents weren't able to send all of them to school, so none of them went. She's in a relationship and has two children who already have their own families. She takes care of two grandchildren who attend school.

María has been making tortillas since 1982, so she knows the business well. She also makes corn tamales and previously she also made pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. The advantage she has is that the business is in her home. Her companion helps her with everything she does.

María needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to make the tortillas, because owing to the drought there will not be a corn harvest and it will be more expensive.

In the future María wants to sell her tortillas not only in her community but also in other places.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her five siblings in Uganda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Elizabeth chose Kepler because it offered her the ability to develop her technology skills. 

Elizabeth plans to major in Business and Communications, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to work in the news industry, perhaps for a telecommunications company.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Njiva Nandrianina

texts.fr:
Njiva est un brave père de famille, diligent quand la question se pose sur le bien-être de sa famille, surtout de son petit enfant de 4 ans. Il a 33 ans et est mariée. Les deux époux travaillaient dans une entreprise de zone franche auparavant, mais depuis 2014, il démarré son activité de vente de chaussures à l'occasion et sa femme une petite gargote. La raison c'est parce que, leurs contrats de travail n'étaient pas à durée indéterminée mais à la tâche, donc il y avait eu des moments pendant lesquels, il n'y avait pas de travail. Le prêt demandé va être utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de roulement de Njiva , il va acheter 5 balles de chaussures à l'occasion. 
Il hérite une vieille maison de ses parents et son objectif est de la réhabiliter et réaménager.
texts.en:
Njiva is a good family father, diligent when it comes to the well-being of his family, especially his young child of four. He is 33 years old and married. The two spouses used to work in a company in the duty-free zone, but in 2014 he started his own business selling used shoes, and his wife opened a little cafe. The reason for this is that their contracts were not for a fixed period but by the job, so there were periods where they had no work.

The requested loan will be used to grow Njiva's working capital. He is going to buy five bales of used shoes. He inherited an old house from his parents and his goal is to repair and refurbish it.

loans.use: to buy five bales of used shoes

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is an ethnic. She is 44 years old and she is married.She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.Hà lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Ma. Lily

texts.en: Ma. Lily is a known hog grower in Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old, married with adult age children. She is glad that Paglaum MPC gives her the opportunity to help her family by engaging into business through its microfinance program. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs, CDs, and other materials for music production.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 33 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a motorcycle business for five years.

Leonard has requested a loan that he will be using to purchase a new motorcycle. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to start a new business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal and clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes to educate her children in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal and clothes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en: Ephantus is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables and tea and also keeps cows. His primary customers are locals. He will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Jerlie is a married woman with 1 child. She is 28 years old and resides in Balingao, Misamis Occidental, Philippine. Jerlie owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business.

Jerlie requested a loan of PHP 19,000 to purchase more best selling items for the store to sell. Recently, Jerlie joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to buy more good items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre joven, tiene veintisiete años edad, es trabajador y emprendedor, se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, habiendo cursado solo la primaria, ha logrado salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo. Hace un par de años formo su familia, con una mujer de su misma edad, que se dedica a elaborar tortillas, juntos procrearon un hijo; por su hogar Juan ha aprendido a luchar, para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, él ya había tenido un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, el cual invirtió en hierro y cemento, con el que creció notablemente. 
Juan est vez ha recurrido a un financiamiento de  Kiva y MiCrédito porque cada cierto tiempo, necesita surtirse de materiales y comprar piezas de hierro, varillas, cemento, piedrín, entre otras cosas. Planea ir dando a conocer más sus servicios, además ir explorando otros campos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a young 27 year old man who's hardworking and enterprising. He works as a mason, has only an elementary school education but has managed to pull through by his own effort. A couple of years ago he started a family with a woman of the same age who works as a tortilla maker, and together they had a child. Juan has learned to work hard for the sake of his household to provide them with a better standard of living. He already has had a loan from Kiva and MiCredito, which he invested in iron and cement, and it was a big boost.

This time Juan is seeking financing from Kiva and MiCredito because he periodically needs to provision himself with materials and buy iron, rods, cement, and gravel amongst other things. He plans to spread the word more about his services, in addition to exploring other lines of work.

loans.use: To purchase pieces of iron, rods, cement, and gravel amongst other things.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es:
Ester, vive con su esposo y un hijo, tiene como negocio la venta de artículos varios como cantaros, lazos, candiles, pailas, etc., tiene dos puestos de venta uno en su vivienda y otro en el mercado municipal, lo tiene desde hace 13 años, lo aprendió por su cuenta, en sus inicios vendía joyería y medicinas, con las ganancias inicio esté nuevo rubro y decidió dejar de realizar la actividad anterior.
Está solicitando un crédito en Padecomsm para comprar más mercadería como lazos, ollas, candiles, pailas, etc., para fortalecer su negocio y mejorar el puesto que tiene en el mercado, Ester busca que sus clientes estén satisfechos, que sus ventas y ganancias sean mayores.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio, agregar nuevos productos y dar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Ester lives with her husband and her son. She has a business in which she sells various items like pitchers, ropes, oil lamps, containers, etc. She has two points of sale: one in her home, and another in the municipal market. She has had this business for 13 years, and learned it all on her own.

In the beginning of her business, she sold jewelry and medicines. With the income from these, she was able to start a new line of work, and decided to stop selling her previous products.

She is requesting a loan with Padecomsm in order to purchase more stock like ropes, pots, oil lamps, containers, etc. in order to strengthen her business and improve its position in the market. Ester wants her customers to be satisfied, and for her sales and earnings to grow. Her dreams are to expand her business, add new products, and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like rope, pots, oil lamps, containers, etc. in order to strengthen her business and improve its position in the market.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, no tiene hijos, su esposo se dedica a realizar viajes.

Claudia, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 3 años, todos lo que sabe del cuidado de cerdos, lo adquirió de su madre, pero a aparte de esa actividad, también trabaja en un cafetín, en el cual trabaja de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. y está a una distancia de 2 kilómetros desde su casa y viaja en vehículo a su lugar de trabajo.

Claudia, necesita el préstamo para comprar 5 cerdos de 3 y 4 meses de nacidos y comprar concentrado para alimentarlos.

Claudia, sueña con ampliar la crianza de cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia, who is 26 years old, studied until high school. She is married, and doesn’t have children. Her husband’s occupation is transporting people.

Claudia has worked in pig breeding for three years. Everything she knows about taking care of pigs she learned from her mother. Besides this occupation, she also works in a snack stand, where she works from 5:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. It is two kilometers from her house, and she travels by car to her workplace.

Claudia needs the loan to buy 5 pigs, which are 3 or 4 years old, and to buy feed to feed them. 

Claudia dreams of increasing the pig breeding and improve the conditions of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs, which are 3 and 4 months old, and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une femme dynamique et débrouillarde de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont  le dernier est en classe de seconde, le second suit en ce moment une formation professionnelle et l'ainé appui son père dans l'exercice de son activité (vente en gros et livraison dans les provinces des légumes).
Jacqueline exerce une activité de commerce en détail depuis très long temps. Les marchandises proposées varient selon les demandes et besoins des clients ou les circonstances et en ce moment de préparation des rentrées scolaires, elle propose des fournitures de bureau et scolaires. Le crédit va être utilisé pour acheter des cahiers de différentes marques. Son but est de développer et étendre son commerce, renforcer le plus possible et au fur et à mesure le fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir améliorer le revenu.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a dynamic and resourceful woman of 42. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom the youngest is in 10th grade. Her second child is presently in professional training, and the eldest helps his father with his business (vegetables: wholesale and delivery to the provinces).

Jacqueline has had a retailing business for a very long time. The merchandise she offers varies according to the demand and the needs of her clients or present circumstances. In this case, where everyone is getting ready to go back to school, she offers office supplies and school supplies.

The loan will be used to buy various brands of notebooks. Her goal is to develop and expand her business, slowly growing her working capital as much as possible, so as to improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy various sorts and brands of notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah is a Babban Gona farmer from Rika Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Micah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve his farming skills. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Micah has ambitious plans to harvest 45 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Micah now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is 61 years old. He is blessed with four children.

He has been in business for 16 years now and has borrowed the loan to boost his farming by purchasing farm inputs.

He hopes this will help him generate additional income.

His hopes and dreams in future are to buy food for his cattle, educate all of his children, and have an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, trabajador independiente del municipio de Ciénaga de Oro dedicado a la fabricación de cofres fúnebres para varias entidades.
 Su trabajo es único en su población y por eso dese sacarle todo el potencial posible.

Su principal dificultad es el clima que en ocasiones puede deteriorar sus creaciones, pero intenta contrarrestarlo con una venta de cofres más fluida.

Solicita un préstamo para compra de madera la cual será utilizada para elaborar estos elementos y así poder ofrecer este vital servicio a la comunidad.

Apoya a un empresario con grandes ganas de progresar y salir adelante con coraje.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single 32 year old man, who works independently in the municipality of Cienega de Oro making funeral coffins for various organizations. He's the only one that does this work in town and that's why he want to utilize its full potential.

His main obstacle is the climate which occasionally deteriorates his creations, but he tries to counteract this by selling at a faster rate.

He's applying for a loan to buy wood that he'll put to use by making these items so that he can provide this vital service to the community. Support an entrepeneur who's hungry to improve and get ahead with his determination.

loans.use: To purchase wood that he'll use to produce these items.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be patient. He owns rental houses. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy tiles and paint to renovate his rental houses. His business goal is to have more houses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his child to university level. This is his second loan with SMEP Micofinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tiles and paint to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 26,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Vision Women Group

texts.en:
Sheila, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Vision Women Group. She is 39 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is goat farming. She is borrowing to purchase a dairy goat. This will increase her output, thus providing more income in order to continue supporting her family and improve their living conditions.

Sheila is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat that will boost income, thus providing for family needs with ease.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 57-year-old lady and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development.

Her economic activity is vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and animal feed to increase production and earn more income. With increased income, she will be in a position to meet her family's expenses, such as food and clothing.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and animal feed to increase production

loans.name: Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group

texts.en:
Josephat, the gentleman raising his hand in the photograph, is a member of Nakuru East Mulembe self-help group. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013 and has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which has equipped him with the skills to effectively manage his enterprise. He is thirty-nine years old and married with two children. He runs a green grocer with his wife and also bakes Mandazi (dough) which he sells to his customers.
He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more stock of flour to expand his baking enterprise. He hopes this will help him boost his business, hence increasing his income. He will therefore be able to support his family by providing for thier basic needs with ease.
Josephat is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour that will help boost the baking enterprise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rose: 45 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She is running a salon and also has a cosmetics shop, which has enabled her to take good care of the family by providing food and proper health care. She is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can expand her enterprise, add more stock, and increase the services offered to the customers. This will improve her living standards by enabling her to provide food and better clothing for her children.

Rose is grateful for Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics and improve her salon for better returns to provide her children with better clothing.

loans.name: Benaline

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Benaline. She is twenty-six years old, married, and a mother of two. She lives with her husband and children.

Benaline does goat keeping as her economic activity. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to manage her enterprise better. She is now borrowing from Kiva in order to boost her business by purchasing goat feed and kids for rearing. She looks forward to a thriving business, thus providing more income to cater for family needs.

She is grateful for the Kiva loan which will be of help to her and her family and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase goat feed and kids that will boost the goat farming business.

loans.name: Daysi Carolina

texts.es: Daysi de 26 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que por su amabilidad cuenta con muchos clientes que la visitan en su negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, además de brindar todos los insumos básicos para su hogar. Daysi desea mejorar sus ingresos adquiriendo mas frutas y verduras para poder suplir las necesidades de sus muchos clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: manzana, sandia, uvas, peras, melones, uvas, fresas, etc. Para aumentar sus ingresos económicos que le permitan darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is 26 years old. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her two children aged 7 and 8 years old. She is a hard-working woman who due to her friendliness has many customers who visit her business selling fruit and vegetables. This is how she generates her economic income to get ahead with her children and provide the basic supplies for her household.

Daysi wants to improve her income acquiring more fruit and vegetables to be able to supply the needs of her many customers. So she is requesting a loan to invest in apples, watermelon, grapes, pears, melons, strawberries, etc. to increase her economic income which would allow her to provide a better quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to invest in apples, watermelon, grapes, pears, melons, strawberries, etc. to increase her economic income which would allow her to provide a better quality of living for her family.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras
Este Dúo lo integra Roselia de58 años de edad ella se dedica desde hace más de quince años  a la elaboración de tejidos típicos y sus tejidos los vende en el mercado. Sus pagos los ha realizado puntualmente y lucha por no fallarle a los inversionistas de kiva a los cuales agradecen.  Su sueño es abrir una tienda de trajes típicos y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Roselia, 58, is a member of a duo, Mujeres Vencedoras. She has worked for more than 15 years making traditional cloth that she sells in the market. She has made her payments punctually and she strives to not disappoint the Kiva lenders, to whom they are grateful.

Roselia's dream is to open a store to sell traditional clothing and help her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making and selling traditional cloth

loans.name: Mario Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Mario de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y asi poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mario, 53, lives in his own home with his spouse and his three children.

He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He grows corn and sorghum, and he started with his own capital. He sells his crops near the area where he lives.

Mario's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, and pest control so he'll be able to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, and pest control

loans.name: Santa Lucita

texts.es: La señora Santa Lucita de 26 años de edad  tiene 2 hijos uno de 10 y otro de 7 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de refacciones en la pequeña escuela y también se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 6 años, este es su 2do crédito que solicita y lo esta solicitando para la compra de insumos  (panes, jugos, aguas, gaseosas, frutas etc.)  y también invertirá una parte del crédito en la compra de productos de belleza como (lociones, lápiz labial, cremas, desinfectantes, zapatos, ropa, maquillajes, shampoo etc.) ya que necesita invertir más en su negocio ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir en su negocio su sueño es poder  superarse  y seguir estudiando en la universidad y para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella agradece y espera su apoyo nuevamente kiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Santa Lucita is twenty-six years old and has two children, one ten year old and a seven year old. She works selling snacks at a small school and has also worked selling beauty products by catalog for six years. This is the second loan that she has requested, and she’s asking for it to buy supplies (breads, juices, water, soft drinks, fruit, etc.). She also will invest part of the loan in buying beauty products (lotions, lipstick, creams, disinfectants, shoes, clothes, makeup, shampoo, etc.) since she needs to invest more in her business but doesn’t have enough capital.

Her dream is to be able to better herself and to continue studying at university. She also wants to give her children a better future. She appreciates this and hopes to get Kiva’s support again.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make snacks and to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda  is 32 years old, married, and supports four children.She  has been  running  a boutique business for the last  ten years. Her monthly income is 20,000 KES. She is borrowing a loan from VisionFund of 30,000 KES to purchase more clothes such as t-shirts, blouses, trousers, and sweaters. She  will use the anticipated profit  to pay school fees for  her  children and repay  the loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to open another business and educate  her  children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes such as t-shirts, blouses, trousers, and sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria Cristiana

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebé de 6 meses, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro lacio y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como chofer y con su hijo que es un bebé recién nacido, viven en un cuarto en alquiler construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes como: pan, azúcar, leche, fideo, arroz, refrescos, y otros, “mi tienda me dá la oportunidad de trabajar y cuidar a mi pequeño bebé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es darle un futuro mejor a su bebé, ella desea realizar la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y darle un futuro a su bebé. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y darle un futuro a su bebé.
texts.en:
Maria is a young woman who is 21 years old, lives with her partner, and has a six-month-old baby. She has a business in which she sells food and basic items in her local corner store. She is a good mother, independent, and very patient. Her business is located in the southern area of the city, which is characterized by the presence of the manufacturing industry.

Maria has a brown complexion, straight black hair, and a slim figure. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver in the transportation industry, and with her recently born son. They live in a rented room that was built with brick and cement, with a roof made of corrugated sheet metal, and which has all the basic amenities.

Her business is in the sale of grocery items like bread, sugar, milk, pasta, rice, beverages, and other products. She says that her store gives her the opportunity to work while taking care of her baby. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales, but the disadvantage that she faces is the lack of capital for stocking her store.

Her dream is to provide a better future for her baby. This is the first loan she is taking from this institution in the three years that she has been running this business. These are the reasons that Maria is requesting a loan, in order to purchase grocery items to stock her business and provide a future for her baby.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies to stock her business and provide a future for her baby.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with 2 children who describes herself a ambitious. She has operated a tailoring business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use 20,000 KES to buy tailoring materials. She hopes to expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a motorcycle business for five years.

He has requested a loan that he will use to purchase a new motorcycle in order to serve more customers and increase his income.

With the anticipated profits, Patrick will be able to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle in order to serve more customers and increase his income.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Emma will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes to other retailers within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Ginalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ginalyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita has a live-in partner with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelita is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Emelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

Emelita has been in this business for five years. Emelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Florenciana

texts.en:
Florenciana is 56 years old and married with four children. Florenciana works very hard to provide for them.

Florenciana has run a general store for 2 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase rice, canned goods, detergent, and candies to sell.

Florenciana would like to save money to expand her business and provide a good future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  rice, canned goods, detergent, and candies.

loans.name: Cesar Wilian

texts.es:
Cesar, utilizo el crédito anterior para reparar el vehículo en que sale a vender agua purificada, atiende más clientes, cuenta con nuevos ingresos y comparte con su familia una vida más digna.
Nuevamente requiere de un crédito para comprar agua purificada envasada, de esta manera cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, tiene la fe que con el uso de créditos mantendrá su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Cesar used the previous loan to repair the vehicle that he uses to sell purified water, and now serves more customers, has additional income and enjoys a higher standard of living with his family. 

Once again he needs a loan to buy bottled purified water so that he can meet customer demand. He trusts that with the use of loans he'll be able to keep his business afloat in the market.

loans.use: To purchase purified bottle water, so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor, juntos tienen una hija tiene 10 años de edad que está estudiando cuarto grado.

María, se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos que lleva a vender al centro escolar de su comunidad, ella vende golosinas, bocadillos y gaseosas cuando los niños salen a recreo; aparte de eso también tiene crianza de aves de corral (gallinas) y cerdos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y dulces para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, porque la demanda es más grande.

Ella, anhela darle el estudio a su hija para que sea profesional y también quiere que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 49 years old, studied until the third grade. She has a partner, and he is a farmer. Together they have a daughter who is 10 years old who is studying the fourth grade. 

Maria wakes up very early to prepare the food that she will sell at the school in her community. She sells candy, sandwiches, and sodas when the children have their lunch break. Besides this, she also breeds birds in small pen (chickens) and pigs.

Maria needs the loan to buy candy, cookies, sodas, and sweets to increase the stock in her business, because the demand is higher. 

She hopes to help her daughter to study so she can become a professional, and she also wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, sodas, and sweets.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen runs a small canned-food production company in Armavir. In the summer season, he also organizes dried-food production and exports the products to neighboring countries. Karen lives with his wife and two children, a son and daughter. Karen's wife works in the secondary school as a teacher.

Karen has applied for this loan to be able to purchase raw materials needed for his canned-food production, He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Karen hopes to receive lenders' support to invest in his production business and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed for canned-food production.

loans.name: Maira Yaneth

texts.es:
Maira, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, que está estudiando.

Maira, tiene una tienda desde hace 8 años, fue por iniciativa propia que la coloco.

Maira, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad como: 1 quintal de azúcar, 2 cajas de aceite, 4 fardos de jabón, 2 arrobas de frijol y bebidas.

Maira, desea mejorar cada vez su tienda, para tener mayor diversidad de productos; también desea seguir apoyando a su hijo hasta que se gradué de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maira is 36 years old and has a 3rd grade education, she's married and has a 14 year old child who's going to school. Maira has had a store for 8 years that she set up through her own initiative.

Maira needs the loan to buy essential products such as: 100 pounds of sugar, 2 boxes of oil, 4 bundles of soap, and 2 25 lb packages of beans and beverages. Maira wants to improve her store every day, so that she can have a wider variety of products. She also wants to continue helping her son until he graduates from college.

loans.use: To purchase essential products such as: 100 lbs of sugar, 2 boxes of oil, 4 bundles of soap, and 2 25 lb packages of beans and beverages.

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Irene, a member of Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is 23 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She is a dairy and poultry farmer.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and received training on enterprise development and decided to start a clothing business. She is borrowing to increase her stock.

She hopes this will enable her to boost her sales and meet the family's needs for food.

Irene appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and Kiva for the support and promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and blessed with 3 children. He operates a motorcycle transportation business (Boda boda) and raises poultry. Training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled him to manage his business well. He needs a loan to buy chicken feed. He hopes this will boost eggs production and earn more income which he will use to pay school fees, clothing, and food.

Julius is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Heshima Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Justina, a member of Heshima Women Group. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She is an active member of the group and has undergone trainings by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management, which have enabled her to start her own enterprise of poultry-keeping. This has improved her life and her family's living standards, such as improved medical care and basic necessities for her family members.

She is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can expand her business by buying more poultry to improve her income. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to buy more poultry for resale

loans.name: Rusi

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Rusi. She is sixty-two years old, married, and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and underwent training on enterprise development and financial management. This enhanced her business management skills.

Rusi does poultry farming as her main economic activity. This has helped her provide the family with basic needs. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy poultry feeds that will boost farming. This will increase eggs and chicken meat production, thus providing increased income to maintain her family needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed that will boost production, thus providing more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, the lady appearing in the photograph, is forty-six years old, married and blessed with six children.
Her economic activity is maize and bean farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013 and she has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.
She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand her enterprise. She hopes this will boost her business, hence increasing her income. She will therefore be able to support her family and improve their standard of living, such as by providing for food and medical care.
Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer that will boost her farming.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, the gentleman appearing in the photograph, is sixty-three years old, married and blessed with two children. His economic activity is farming maize, beans and poultry. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013 and received training on enterprise development and financial planning which equipped him with the skills to effectively manage his enterprise.
He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his enterprise. This will help him boost his business, hence increasing his income. He will therefore be able to support his family by providing them with food and clothing.
Joel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer that will boost output.

loans.name: Heshima Women Group

texts.en: The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Heshima Women Group. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of three children. Since she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, Mary has been trained on enterprise development, savings and resource mobilization which has enabled her to manage her tailoring business by keeping good business records. She is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can expand her enterprise and add more stock to access a larger market. This will enable her to take good care of her family by providing them with food and proper health care, thus improving their standards of living. Mary is grateful for Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to add more stock of cloth to boost her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rose. She is 39 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 and has been trained on enterprise and financial management. 

She grows maize, beans, oranges and mangoes as her main economic activity. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy seedlings, fertilizers and a farm equipment, such as a knapsack sprayer, to improve her farming. This, she hopes, will earn her more income to pay school fees and provide better food to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer to improve her faming and be able to provide school fees and better food for her family

loans.name: Chore Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Chore Poty, conformado por 17 integrantes, se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo; todas con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades que están llevando a cabo, cada una con metas propias para lograr mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Buenaventura quien se dedica a la ventas al por menor, cuenta con una despensa en su casa a donde van todos sus vecinos de la comunidad y compran en su local. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que está saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo arduo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos variados para poder seguir son sus ventas, y poder comprar verduras, carne, panificados, lácteos y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Chore Poty". It is composed of seventeen members who are in their fourth loan cycle. They all have very good prospects with regard to the activities that they are carrying out, and each woman has her own goals to achieve in order to improve her family's living situation.

One of the members, who is characterized by being very enterprising, is Señora Buenaventura, who is in retail sales. She has a small grocery store in her house, to which all her neighbors in the community come and purchase in her store.

She is a very hardworking woman who is getting ahead by means of her effort and arduous work, and she is requesting this loan for the purchase of various supplies, so that she can continue with her sales. She will be able to purchase vegetables, meat, baked goods, dairy products, and other items.

She is grateful for receiving the opportunity to be able to continue investing in her work.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, baked goods, dairy products, and other items, in order to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es: Lorena es una empresaria independiente domiciliada en el municipio de Galapa en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de apenas un año de edad. Ella se vio forzada a desistir de su empleo al quedar embarazada por quebrantos en su salud, sin embargo se inició en el comercio de mercancías económicas y detalles, las cuales ofreció a sus amigos, conocidos y vecinos para cancelar a cómodas cuotas, actividad en la que logró el éxito y continuó con mucha más variedad de mercancías entre ellas prendas de vestir, accesorios, maquillajes y perfumes.  Lo que más disfruta Lorena de su trabajo es que lo puede combinar con las labores en el hogar y el cuidado de su hijo.  Todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. acuerda citas con sus clientes y llega a hasta sus residencias para mostrarles las nuevas colecciones. Hoy en día está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en prendas de vestir y accesorios los cuales promoverá para la temporada que se avecina de amor y amistad.  Su meta a futuro es tener una miscelánea y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Lorena is an independent enterprising woman who lives in the municipality of Galapa with her spouse and their son who is nearly 1. 

She was forced to give up her job when she became pregnant due to her health deteriorating, despite this she began her business selling merchandise and little gifts, which she offers to her friends, acquaintances and neighbours to cancel out fees.  
This is an activity in which she found success and carried on with a variety of merchandise, including clothing garments, accessories, make-ups and perfumes. 
 
What Lorena enjoys most about her work is that she can combine the household chores and looking after her son. 

Everyday from 9am until 8pm she arranges meetings with her clients and goes to their households to show them the new collections. 

Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, to invest in clothing garments and accessories which she will promote for the coming season of love and friendship. 

Her future goal is to have a corner shop and to buy a house.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and accessories

loans.name: Joshat

texts.en:
Josphat is 22 years old. He is not married and has no children.

He has had a motorcycle business for three years.

He has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase a new motorcycle, and he hopes this will help him open another business.

His hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to  purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Reina Maritza

texts.es:
Reina, con la ayuda de los créditos mantiene funcionando la venta de tamales, tortillas y una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, sus ingresos son estables y puede mejorar día con día el estilo de vida familiar.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para básicamente comprar carnes, granos básicos, especias, bebidas, maíz y leña, tanto para preparar la venta de tortillas y tamales como para surtir la tienda, considera que así tendrá clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Reina with the help of her loans has kept her sales of tamales and tortillas functioning as well as her basic food product store. Her income is stable and day by day she can improve the family's lifestyle.

She has applied for another loan basically to buy meat, basic grains, spices, drinks, corn and wood, to prepare her tortillas and tamale sales as well as stock her store. She believes his will keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, spices, drinks, corn and wood, to prepare her tortillas and tamale sales as well as stock her store.

loans.name: Thika Jikwamue Self Help Group

texts.en:
Benjamin (shown raising his hand) joined Hand in Hand Easter Africa in 2013. He has benefited specifically in saving and resource mobilization, enterprise development, financial management, and value chain and market linkage training offered by Hand in Hand East Africa.

He requests a Kiva loan to add to his savings and buy an additional motorbike for his passenger transportation business. He hopes this will increase his income and enable him to support his family with basic needs like food, clothing, and shelter.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to  buy a motor cycle for his transportation service.

loans.name: Zulma Odilia

texts.es:
Zulma, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 9,5 y 3 años de edad y actualmente tiene 6 meses de embarazo.

Zulma, es cosmetóloga, ella práctica esta profesión en su casa; aparte de eso también se dedica a la venta de productos de revista, su hermana le ayuda a cuidar sus niños, mientras ella realiza alisados o está vendiendo productos.

Zulma, necesita el dinero para comprar productos para el cuidado de la salud y belleza y para  comprar instrumentos de cosmetología y poder desempeñar las dos actividades.

Ella, anhela garantizar el futuro de sus hijos y darles educación, un techo digno y alimentación.
texts.en:
Zulma is 28 years old and studied until the 9th grade. She has a partner and has children of 12, 9, 5 and 3 years of age, she is currently 6 months pregnant. 

Zulma is a cosmetician which she practices this from her home; besides this she also sells catalogue products. Her brother helps her look after the children, whilst she performs makeovers or sells products. 

Zulma needs the money to buy healthcare and beauty products, and to buy cosmetic equipment to be able to carry out both activities.

She aspires to guarantee the future of her children and to give them an education, a respectable home and food.

loans.use: to buy healthcare and beauty products and to buy cosmetic equipment

loans.name: Nii Nii Bahe Le Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the group called nii nii bahe le, which is located in Accra, Ghana. They sell assorted ornament, drinks, fresh fish, and grocery items.

Florence is a married, 33-year- old woman with 2 children. She sells assorted ornaments from her home. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She is an enterprising woman who wants to move her family ahead. She has many years of experience in this business and is going very well. Her dream is to expand the business to the highest level. She requests a loan to buy assorted ornaments to sell. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy assorted ornaments.

loans.name: Set- Kobor Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Bernard, a member of set-Kobor group in Nakuru. He is twenty-five years old, married, and blessed with one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in February 2014.

Bernard does maize and beans farming; he also keeps poultry. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to run his enterprise better and profitably, unlike before.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and chicken feeds. This will increase his farm production and meet the demand for cereals; the enterprise will earn him more income and go a long way in supporting his family basic needs and medical care.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and chicken feeds. This will lead to improved productivity and thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Miriam: thirty-five years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year in 2014 to be trained on and acquire skills in better savings and enterprise management and development. She has also gained skills on how to run her restaurant enterprise and manage her income in an efficient manner.

She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by buying more crockery in order to earn more income, which will enable her to uplift the living standards for her family and also enable her to get a better education for her children. She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for their assistance and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to buy crockery for her hotel business, thus attracting more clients, which will increase her income. This will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. She has operated a clothing retail business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use 40,000 KES to increase her stock of clothing, which is in high demand. Her business goal is to have a boutique with different kinds of clothing within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and educate her child.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid .

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rigo Osmi

texts.es: Don Rigo, tiene 62 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa Santa Bárbara con su esposa. El siempre ha buscado como obtener ingresos para la familia, lleva 10 años que vende golosinas, jugos, refrescos, churros, confites y galletas. Su negocio lo tiene en un punto estrategico donde hay afluencia de clientes y buen movimiento en ventas. Ha solicitado 3 préstamos anteriores a ODEF para su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 21,000 lempiras para comprar más producto como jugos, agua en bolsa, refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas y otras golosinas para revender y seguir con su trabajo aumentando las ventas e ingresos. Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para movilizar mejor su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rigo is 62 years old, married, has two children, and resides in the municipality of Azacualpa in Santa Barbara with his wife. He has always tried to find a way to obtain income for his family. For ten years he has been selling sweets, juice, soda, sweet fried dough, candy, and cookies. His business is located in a strategic location where there are a large number of customers and good sales.

He has taken out three previous loans with ODEF for his business. He is currently requesting another loan of 21,000 Honduran lempiras in order to purchase more products like juice, water in bags, soda, sweet fried dough, candies, cookies, and other sweets to resell and continue increasing his sales and his income. His dream is to be able to purchase a vehicle in order to make his business mobile and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more products like juices, water in bags, soda, sweet fried dough, candies, cookies, and other sweet to resell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 45-year-old single woman with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Cecilia is a vegetable farmer. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she was not able to keep her farming records. However, after undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and financial management, she has improved her management skills.

She is borrowing money from Kiva to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will boost sales and provide more income which she will use to meet the family's needs. She hopes this extra income will enable her to provide food, shelter, and school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines, de 47 años de edad, estudio bachillerato general, está acompañada, su pareja tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas, junto a su pareja tiene una hija que ya es mayor de edad.

Ines, se dedica a lavar y planchar desde hace muchos años y por las tardes vende pupusas en su casa, se ha decidido a
