trabajar de esta manera para obtener mejores ingresos; en las tardes su hija le ayuda en la pupuseria y el horario de venta es de 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m.
 
Ines, solicita el préstamo para comprar láminas para hacer una galera para estar más segura cuando elabore las pupusas, de esa manera atenderá mejor a sus clientes y obtendrá mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Ines, es que su hijo se prepare academicamente.
texts.en:
Ines, 47, has a high school education, she is married and her partner has a bicycle repair shop. They have a daughter who is an adult.

Ines has made a living washing and pressing laundry for many years and in the afternoon she sells stuffed tortillas out of her home. She decided to do this type of work to make a larger income. Her daughter helps her in the afternoon in the shop selling stuffed tortillas from 4:00 pm until 7:00 pm.

Ines is requesting a loan to buy sheet metal to construct a galley so she is safer while making stuffed tortillas. This will allow her to better serve her customers and to increase her income.

Ines' dream is for her daughter to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to construct a galley so she is safer while making stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en: Idd is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells tires, lubricants, and auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tires and lubricants. He hopes that in the future, he will have a more productive business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires and lubricants

loans.name: Mugwathi Poultry Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The gentleman raising his hand in the photograph is Thomson. He is sixty six years old, married and blessed with five children. Thomson’s economic activity is maize and bean farming. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013 and he has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which has equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise.
 
He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his enterprise. He hopes this will boost his business hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to support his family by providing basic needs such as food. Thomson is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer that will boost farming thus more income to care for family needs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Gladys. She is married and a mother of two children. Gladys is twenty three years 
old. She joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa in April 2013. She received training on enterprise development and financial planning which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise of maize, beans and vegetable farming.

Gladys is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She hopes this will boost her farming thus increase her income. This will enable her cater for family needs such as food and clothing. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married woman and has two children. She describes herself as loving. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables. 

She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Gloria has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like lotion, body spray, and lipstick to sell to her customers.

Gloria has been in this business for a year now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products like lotion, body spray, and lipstick to sell to her customers

loans.name: Claris Maribel

texts.es:
Claris, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera de dos hijas que están estudiando.

Claris, se dedica a vender tortillas, el negocio lo inicio porque es madre soltera y no tenía a nadie que le ayudará para darle lo necesario a sus hijas, sus hijas le ayudan a hacer las tortillas y su horario de venta es 8:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m. y de 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña, porque debido a la sequía el maíz está más caro, con el préstamo podrá comprar bastante y tenerlo disponible para cuando lo necesite. 

Claris, sueña con que sus hijas estudien y se gradúen de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Claris, 43, has a fourth grade education and she is a single mother to two daughters who both attend school.

Claris makes a living selling tortillas, a business that she started because she is a single mother and she had nobody to help her provide for her daughters. Her daughters help her make the tortillas and she sells them from 8:00 am until 12:00 pm and from 4:00 pm until 7:00 pm.

She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood, because due to the drought, corn is more expensive. Using the loan, she will be able to buy a sufficient amount and have it available for when she needs it.

Claris' dream is for her daughters to attend school and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret has finished paying her previous loan. She was able to add more stock of flour, salt and sugar and washing detergents. Her income improved and she was able to provide basic needs for her family with ease. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her business further by adding more stock of food stuffs. She looks forward to more income thus ensuring food security in her household. Margaret is grateful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuffs that will boost income.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha lives at Nima a suburb of Accra. She is forty-nine years of age. She is a trader and landlady. There is no toilet facility in her house so she and her tenants resort to the public toilet which is not very convenient to them as a result of its unhygienic conditions. As a landlady she consulted her tenants about the need for them to have their toilet facility and they all agreed to that.

Ayesha is requesting for this loan to build a modern toilet facility for the household. She will repay the loan out of the contributions she will receive from the tenants.

loans.use: To construct a modern toilet facility in her house for her family and tenants.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is a from Ormoc, Leyte. She is a 63-year-old widow who relies on selling fish, crabs and shrimp to earn a living. She works hard so that she will not be dependent on her adult children. Carlita is asking for a loan to buy more fish, shrimp and crabs. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus increasing her sales and income. In the future, Carlita hopes to save and always have the strength to continue doing her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy crab, shrimp and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, vegetables, fish and tomatoes.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 2 years.  She also earns income from selling fish.

Marites has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Nenita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for a year now.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Rachel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soy sauce, cooking oil, bread, eggs, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. Rachel has been in this business for 6 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soy sauce, cooking oil, bread, eggs, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda works hard to support her family. Esmeralda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Esmeralda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Esmeralda has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.es:
Edwin es una apersona dedicada a practicar la agricultura y crianza de ganado, oficio que su padre le inculco, hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos y sus actividades las desarrolla con ayuda mozos; es soltero, tiene tres hijos pero no viven con él, actualmente vive con su padre.
Requiere de un crédito para reparar el vehículo de trabajo, que le permite trasladar alimento y agua para el ganado, así como también es de utilidad para realizar sus trabajos agrícolas, el vivir en una zona rural hace que sus actividades necesiten un medio de trasporte exclusivo.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar trabajando, cancelar sus deudas y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edwin makes a living farming and raising livestock, a trade which his father taught him. Now it is his source of income and he does this work with the help of a few young men. He is single, he has three children who do not live with him and he currently lives with his father.

He needs a loan to repair his work vehicle, which allows him to transport food and water for his livestock. The vehicle is also used to complete his farming duties. He lives in a rural area, which means that he requires his own mode of transportation to do his job.

He aspires to continue working and to pay off his debts so he is financially stable.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle, which allows him to transport food and water for his livestock.

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara, solicita un crédito comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla de pipían para cultivar una manzana de terreno, otra parte le servirá para pagar obreros que le ayuden a realizar sus actividades agrícolas.
Con la facilidad que  le dio el crédito anterior finalizo en un tiempo justo la siembra de sus cultivos, pago el alquiler del terreno y los mozos que contrato en esa temporada, está inversión le ha permitido ampliar su negocio e ir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Xiomara is asking for a loan to buy fertiliser, insecticides, herbicides and pumpkin seeds to cultivate a block of land,another part of it will help her to pay labourers who will help her carry out her agricultural activities. 

With the ease with which she was given her previous loan she finished harvesting her crops quickly, paid to rent the terrain and the workers she hired in this season. This investment has allowed her to expand her business and to fulfil her obligations.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, insecticides, herbicides and to buy pumpkin seeds to cultivate a block of land

loans.name: Armida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Armida, considera de mucha importancia la utilización de créditos en su negocio ya que de esta manera puede llevar el sustento diario  a su hogar, el nuevo crédito lo invertir en la compra de ingredientes como: carnes, verduras, pan, harina, aceite, bebidas, etc., para continuar vendiendo pupusas, comida y bebidas, espera que las personas que visitan su negocio se mantengan satisfechos.
Con ayuda de financiamientos su negocio se mantiene competitivo ya que ha incorporado nuevas opciones de meriendas, tiene mejores ganancias y las utiliza para suplir las necesidades de su familia y remodelar el local del negocio.
texts.en:
For Armida, it is very important to use loans for her business because this is how she can financially maintain her household day by day. She will invest the new loan in the purchase of ingredients such as: meats, vegetables, bread, flour, oil, beverages, etc., to continue to sell "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), meals and beverages. She hopes to maintain her customers satisfied.

With the help of the loans, her business stays competitive since there are new lunch meal options and she will earn better profits that she will use to cover the needs of her family and to remodel the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as: meats, vegetables, bread, flour, oil, beverages, etc., to continue to sell "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), meals and beverages.

loans.name: Hildah

texts.en: Hildah a permanent resident of Kyanja, Kisaasi, is married with four children. Hildah is running a retail shop at her home. She uses part of the profits to pay school fees for the children and the balance for home consumption. Due to high demand for goods in the area and potentially high profits, she wants to boost her business by purchasing more commodities. She wants to borrow UGX 1,500,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI)

loans.use: To boost her retail business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 44 years of age and married to a taxi driver.  They have three children. 

Diana sells bags of water, rice, cooking oil, and gari from her porch at her family house. She has been in this business for 20 years.

The major challenge she faces in her water business is inadequate funds to expand. She is preparing to use one of her rooms as a shop, and she will require enough capital to buy more water to stock her shop.

With this loan, Diana will buy more bags of water to sell.  She is hopeful that her business will expand in five years' time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une femme travailleuse et courageuse de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont deux seulement restent à sa charge en ce moment, l'un déjà universitaire et l'autre secondaire dans un collège privé. 
Son mari est tireur de pousse-pousse donc son revenu est très faible et aléatoire. De ce fait, pour l'aider et l'appuyer à entretenir et soutenir la famille, Jacqueline exerce une activité de vente de fruits de mer depuis déjà 2002. 
Actuellement, son problème est l'électricité: elle n'a pas encore d'électricité chez elle, le congélateur de stockage devrait être déposé chez une amie. Donc sa priorité est d'avoir de l’électricité le plutôt possible, C'est la procédure administrative qui est un peu lent, en plus la gestion de la société de distribution de l'électricité appartient à l’État Malagasy.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a hard-working and courageous woman of 40. She is married and the mother of five children, of whom only two are still her responsibility at present. One is already at the university and another in a private high school. Her husband pulls a rickshaw, so his income is minimal and random. With this scenario to strengthen her and push her to support her family, Jacqueline has been in a small business selling seafood since 2002.

Presently, her problem is electricity. She does not have electricity at home, so the freezer where she stores her inventory has to be left with a friend. So her priority is to have electricity as soon as possible. It is the administrative procedures that are a bit slow and moreover, the company responsible for distributing electricity is run by the Malagasy Government.

loans.use: to buy seafood: capitaine (may refer to hogfish), cabot (may refer to wrasse), and gogo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sandals to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 46-year-old married mother of four children, two currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lorna has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on sacks of maize and manioc.

loans.name: Mae Jessica

texts.en:
Mae Jessica is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past eight years, she has been running a dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns an income from buying and selling jewelry. Mae Jessica works hard to provide for her family.

Mae Jessica is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF. Mae Jessica aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 41 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Tita has been in this business for 19 years now. She requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Tita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a young man of thirty-eight years and a single parent of one child. He lives in Nima, a suburb of Accra. He is a sachet water seller who used to buy the water in large quantities for resale. For some time now his capital has been reduced and that has made it difficult for him to buy the sachet water in larger quantities. 

He is requesting for this loan to enable him re-stock his store to meet the demand of his clients and increase his income to manage his home.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water for resale

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is a 49-year-old man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children who are still studying. Their ages are 15 and 17. Victoriano runs a sari-sari (variety) store in Bien Unido and he also operates a transportation business in Talibon, Bohol, with the use of his tricycle. 

Victoriano is requesting a loan to buy spare tires for his tricycle along with sprockets and oil. He will also buy soft drinks, canned food, toiletries, seasonings, and condiments to sell in his store. Victoriano is determined that his children will finish school and earn a degree. They are his inspiration and why he works so hard. In the future, Victoriano plans to make his businesses more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy spare tires, sprockets, and oil as well as products for his general store

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory, es  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres lo cual les ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Glady, pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en su pequeña gomería, quiere comprar cubiertas y combustibles y de esa manera intenta aumentar los ingresos de su familia. Está casada, tiene hijos, y tanto ella como su marido se ayudan para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. En la foto del grupo hay 16 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene 16 integrantes, pero solo 15 de ellas piden este prestamo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory Group is from the city of San Ignacio. The women in it are united and in solidarity. They work together in activities, and they declare that they are happy, and feel the support of the Women's Communal Bank Program, which is helping them to improve their living conditions.

Señora Glady is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in her small tire repair shop. She wants to purchase tire treads and fuel, and in this way, increase her family's income. She is married with children, and she and her husband help each other so that they can provide for their family.

She is grateful to receive the opportunity to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. There are sixteen women in the photo because the group has sixteen members, but only fifteen of them are requesting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase tire treads and fuel in order to stock her tire repair shop.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are ladies. 

Scolastica describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of modern salon equipment. She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy modern salon equipment and hopes that in the future she will be able to educate all her kids. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy modern salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as maize, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Exaucé Group

texts.fr: Mbashile est commerçante, vice-présidente de la banque villageoise «Exaucé», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 75 ans, mère  de  11 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés et 9 sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés au marché central de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en 40 poissons. Il commença son activité par le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite scolariser  et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mbashile is a retailer and vice-president of the 'Banc Villageoise' Exaucé which works with the field partner, Hekima. She is seventy-five years old, married and mother to eleven children. Two of her children are still at school, the rest are grown up.

Mbashile has been selling salted fish at the central market in town since she was very young. She will use her loan to buy forty fish for sale. Her business was started with funds provided by her husband. She would like to be able to feed and educate her children.

Mbashile is very grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 40 fish for sale.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like candies, biscuits, noodles, bread, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like candies, biscuits, noodles, bread, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aminamo

texts.ru: Эту девушку зовут Аминамо. Она жительница города Сарбанд. Аминамо разведена с мужем, она имеет троих маленьких детей. Она живет вместе с матерью и детьми. Аминамо 26 летняя мама. Она талантливая самостоятельная женщина. Аминамо занимается певицей в ресторане. Она проводит свадьбы, день рождения и мероприятия. Вот так Аминамо зарабатывает, и кормить  семью. Сейчас она хочет отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семье. Аминамо обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее нет сумма денег для ремонта. С такими планами она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
This young woman is called Aminamo. She lives in the Sarband region. Aminamo is divorced from her husband, and she has 3 small children. She lives with her mother and children. She is a 26-year-old mother. She is a talented and independent woman. Aminamo is a singer at a restaurant. She sings at weddings, birthdays, and events. That's how Aminamo earns money and feeds her family.

Now, Aminamo wants to repair her house and improve her family's living conditions. She has applied for a loan because she lacks the sum of money she needs for the repair. With these plans, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Ее зовут Шодигул. Ей 65 лет. Она веселая и жизнелюбивая женщина. Она замужем. Шодигул вместе с мужем живут в районе Кубадиён. Их дети взрослые и уже обзаведены семьями. Шодигул с мужем занимаются животноводством. Они работают вместе бок о бок в течение 3 лет. Шодигул и ее муж решили купить еще несколько скотин и увеличить поголовья скота.  Для реализации ее плана необходимы финансы, которых она надеется получить за счет кредита.
texts.en:
This is Shodigul. She is 65 years old. She is a cheerful woman full of joie de vivre. She is married. Shodigul and her husband live in Qubadiyon area. Their children are adults and already have families. Shodigul and her husband are engaged in animal husbandry. They have been working side by side for three years. 

Shodigul and her husband decided to buy a few more heads of cattle to increase their cattle headcount. In order to achieve her plan she needs funds, which she hopes to receive with a loan.

loans.use: to buy some heads of cattle.

loans.name: Intizor

texts.ru: Интизор из города Вахдат. Она замужем и мать троих детей. 2 сыновей и 1 дочка. Детям 18, 20 и 28 лет. Тарший сын женат. Младшие еще не семейные. Старший сын занимается животноводством. Младшие помогает маме в работе. Невестка ведет домашнее хозяйство. Интизору 57 лет. Она на земле занимается растениеводством. Растениеводство ее любимое дело. Интизор обожает растение. Она сейчас собирается, посадит новый урожай. Интизор решила взять кредит и приобрести семян  урожай и минеральные удобрения. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Intizor is from the town of Vahdat. She is married and the mother of three children: two sons and a daughter. Her children are 18, 20 and 28 years old. The younger children are not yet married. Her eldest son rears animals. The younger children help their mother to work. Her daughter-in-law looks after the house. Intizor is 57 years old. She grows crops. Growing crops is her favorite activity. Intizor loves plants. She is currently getting ready to plant new crops. Intizor has decided to take a loan and to buy some seeds and mineral fertilizer. She has applied for a loan to do this.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид добрый и понимающий человек. Ему 53 года, женат и отец двоих детей.   Саид считается одним из успешных предпринимателей в своем районе. У него можно приобрести все виды сладостей, и он всегда готов с улыбкой обслужить своих клиентов. Саид занимается этим бизнесом более 20 лет и это является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Скоро 1 сентября, начало учебного года и Саиду необходимо купить компьютер, школьные принадлежности и одежду для своих детей. Но для этого у Саида нет достаточных средств, и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Саид очень полагается на Ваше внимание.
texts.en: Said is a kind and understanding person. He is 53 years old, married, and the father of two children. Said is considered a successful entrepreneur in his area. One can buy all sorts of sweets from him, and he is always ready to serve his customers with a smile. Said has been running this business for over 20 years and it is the sole source of income for his family. Soon it will be September 1st, the start of the academic year, and Said needs to buy a computer, school supplies and clothes for his children. But Said does not have enough funds for this, and so he has applied for a loan. Said is really relying on your attention.

loans.use: to buy a computer, school supplies and clothes for his children.

loans.name: Zavra

texts.ru: Завра проживает на районе Н. Хусрав. Ей 48 года. Она замужем и имеет детей.  Завра живет вместе с мужем и детьми. Завра  дома занимается животноводческой деятельности. У нее не большое количество скотин. Она хочет изменить ситуацию. Завра планирует расширить деятельность, приобрести еще пару голов скотов и увеличить доходность. У Завра не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы совершить покупку, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Zavra lives in the N. Khursav region. She is 48 and married with children. She lives with her husband and children and works at home in animal husbandry. She has a small number of livestock. She wants to improve her situation and plans to expand her business by buying a pair of animals to increase her income. She doesn't have enough money to do this so she is looking for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 59 year old married woman living with her husband and two children, one of them is still studying. Her husband is the main source of income to satisfy the family needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle and as she says, she is dedicated only to her family.

Today, in order to pay her child university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay his university fees and to pursue his education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her child's university fees.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto, 62 years old, is from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living through rice farming. With rice being the staple food in the country, he has his share of profits from his hard work from previous harvest seasons. 

With the money that he requested from the loan, he plans to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer and pay for the labor of the hired help. He plans to work harder on his farm so he can expect a good harvest and increase his profitability. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption, future savings and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer and pay for the labor of the hired help

loans.name: Roshiel

texts.en:
Roshiel is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a 21-year-old married woman and the mother of a three-year-old child. Roshiel has been in the rice farming business with her husband for five years now. This is the source of her income.

Roshiel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. With these, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her crop yield and profit. Roshiel dreams of expanding her business in the future. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a single woman, with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious, as she operates a retail business where she sells bed sheets, pillow cases, shirts and other items. She also owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables.She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bed sheets, pillow cases, shirts. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed sheets, pillow cases, shirts

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Luisa will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maria Yaneth

texts.es:
María, es acompañada, tiene una vida familiar con su pareja y dos hijos que aún son dependientes, no tienen ayuda del extranjero, ella tiene un negocio de venta de licuados de diferentes frutas, su horario de trabajo es de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia que la respalda y le evita tener inconvenientes, así ella genera ingresos importantes para sostener a su familia.
Opta por un crédito para comprar una hielera para conservar los ingredientes de los licuados en óptimas condiciones, el resto le permitirá hacer pequeñas remodelaciones en el local de su negocio, pretende dar una buena imagen de su establecimiento para atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
La visión de María es ampliar su negocio ofreciendo nueva mercadería y generar los ingresos que sean necesarios para pagarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is in a committed relationship and has a family life with her partner and two children who are still dependent. They don't receive any help from outside the country. She has a businesses selling smoothies made from different types of fruit. Her working hours are from nine in the morning until nine at night. She has lots of experience, which helps her avoid problems in the business, and thus she earns important income in order to support her family.

She is choosing to request a loan in order to purchase a cooler to preserve the ingredients of her smoothies in the best condition, and the rest of the loan will allow her to complete some small renovations in her business. She hopes to create a good image of her business in order to attract new customers and increase her sales and earnings. Her vision is to expand her business by offering new products, and to generate the necessary income to pay for her children's college educations.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler to preserve the ingredients of her smoothies in optimal conditions and to complete some small renovations in her business.

loans.name: Nady

texts.en:
Nady is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like packs of biscuits, canned goods, personal care products, sacks of rice, etc.. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Nady dreams that one day she will be able to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like packs of biscuits, canned goods, personal care products, sacks of rice, etc.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a married woman with two children. Miraflor is 31 years old and both her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Miraflor has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Miraflor requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Miraflor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 37-year-old, married mother of four children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her children's school tuition fees and transportation. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Nada hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees and transportation

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз молодой житель района Бохтар. Он единственный сын в семье. Бехрузу 23 года. Он живет вместе мамой. Бехруз занимается мастером по ремонту домов. У него не получилось получить высшую образованию. По причине, что у него бело денег для учебы. Потом он начал зарабатывать на жизнь. Сейчас в семье работает только Бехруз, и он обеспечить семью один. Бехруз очень любить свою маму, и кроме мамы у него никого нет. Он просит денег, чтобы помочь маме купить лекарство для лечения. Его мама заболела, ей нужно лекарство. Сейчас Бехрузу очень нужно деньги, и он обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Behruz is a young man from the Bokhtar region. He is the only son in the family. 
Behruz is 23 years old. He lives together with his mother. Behruz's occupation is home repairs. 
He couldn't receive higher education because he didn't have money for his studies. Then he started earning his living. 
At the moment Behruz is the only one working in the family, and he is the sole provider for the family. 
Behruz loves his mother very much, and he doesn't have anyone else beside her. He is asking for money to help his mother buy medicine needed for her treatment. His mother is sick, and the medicine is necessary.
Right now Behruz is need of money, so he turned to you for a loan. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for mother's treatment.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves is 36 years old, single and operates a fruit stand at Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been into this business for 5 years and has good sales. She receives an approximate income of PHP 10,000.00 per month. She sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and availed on various services including insurance and health care. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bulk supplies of fruits like banana, avocado, pineapple, watermelon & others.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies of fruits like banana, avocado, pineapple, watermelon & others

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be goal-oriented. She operates a posho mill where she sells maize flour. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low inventory. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more maize. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 45 years old, married with 3 school age children. He is a farmer in Brgy. 5, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He started his farmer activity way back year 1990 with a small capital He started growing tomatoes, red bell pepper and eggplant. He save a part of his profit and talk to neighboring land owner to allow him cultivate their land which later on he bought. Now, he grows varieties of fruits like mango, banana and others. He is grateful that their is Paglaum MPC that financed his farming activities. Recently, he avails his 4th loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation & purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation & purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy animal feeds. Her business goal is to buy more land and keep more dairy cows within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Segundo Moises

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, vive solol en una zona rural del distrito de Santo tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Seundo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 29 years old, married, and lives alone in a rural area in the Santo Tomás district, located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this area work mostly in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Segundo works in the breeding and selling of small animals like chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others. He runs his business out of his own home. He has several years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area.

The loan that he is requesting will be used for the purchase of a larger quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as for the purchase of balanced feed for them. In this way, Segundo hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to increase his income and, as a result, improve his own quality of life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others.

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Vergelia earns additional income from a general store

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jlg-011-Valayapatti Group

texts.en:
Selvi is a 34-year-old daily wage labourer who lives with her husband and two children. She lives in Kulithalai in the state of Tamil Nadu. Her family is dependent on agriculture for sustenance and they make do with their monthly household income of Rs. 9,000.

The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of three (the women in the picture), led by Selvi, have understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But they do not have the means to build one. With no access to a toilet, Selvi and her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. Due to a lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of contracting infections. They fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Thus, the group has decided to apply for a loan for Rs. 42,000. This will fund the construction of toilets in their respective homes. Your loan would help them access sanitation facilities that most take for granted. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Bonheur Group

texts.fr: Bernadette est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise «Bonheur», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 53 ans, mère  de 6 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés au marché central de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 250 poissons. Il commença son activité par le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite scolariser  et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bernadette is a small-scale merchant, the president of the loan group called «Bonheur» (Happiness), and a client of MFI Hekima. She is married, aged 53, and the mother of six children, all with schooling. She has been selling salted fish at a market in town for 15 years. She is going to add to her inventory by buying 250 fish.

Bernadette began her business with working capital received from her husband. She would like to pay school fees and feed her children. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up by buying 250 fish.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell for her buy-and-sell clothes business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money for a good future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jlg-003(A)-Keelakuttapatti Group

texts.en:
Tamilselvi is a 44-year-old woman who works hard as a daily wage labourer to sustain her family of 5. She has formed a self-help group with her friends Jeyanthai and Aarayi in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her finances are not adequate for her family to fund the construction of a toilet in their home. Her family has to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. The women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

The group seeks a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities in her home

loans.name: Jlg-011(A)-Valayapatti Group

texts.en:
42-year-old Saroja is the mother of two children. In addition to managing the household chores, she works as a daily wage labourer. Saroja leads a group of three women in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. 

Saroja works hard to sustain her family on her limited income. Her family has no access to toilets, and they therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, the group now seeks a loan of 42,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation and consequently safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Jlg-009-Marudhur Group

texts.en:
Shanthi, aged 32, works as a daily wage labourer in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She has formed a self-help group with her friends. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her finances are not adequate for her family to access basic necessities like toilets in their home. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. The family members, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Seeking to improve their situation, the group seeks a loan of Rs.42,000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-009-Panikkampatti Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Sagunthala lives with her husband and two little children in Kulithalai in the state of Tamil Nadu. She leads a group of four women who need financial assistance to construct toilets in their homes.

The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of four has understood the importance of having a toilet at home, but they do not have the means to build one. With no access to a toilet, their families have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. Their women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves.

Due to the lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Together, they seek a loan of INR 56,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these four families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Jlg-011-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
Mahalakshmi lives with her husband and infant in Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She is a daily wage labourer who manages the household expenses with her household monthly income of INR 8,500. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Mahalakshmi's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with 3 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Mahalakshmi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, the group now seeks a loan of INR 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings and improved productivity.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities in her home

loans.name: Jlg-003-Keelakuttapatti Group

texts.en:
Kalaiselvi is a mother of a teenaged child. She is a daily wage labourer. Her family is dependent on agriculture for a living. Kalaiselvi and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Kalaiselvi understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group of 3 women who have come together to apply for a loan of IDR 42,000. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Dúo Guate Maya Group

texts.es:
Dúo Guate Maya
Este dúo lo forma Sandra es de 23 años de edad es del área de san Martin jilotepeque. Sandra se dedica a elaboración de tejidos y bordados típicos.  Ella es madre de familia y lucha por apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y materiales para tejidos. Y agradece a Kiva  por apoyarla en su negocio.
texts.en:
"Dúo Guate Maya" was formed by Sandra who is 23 years old and from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. Sandra makes a living producing traditional fabric and embroidery. She is a mother and she struggles to support her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy thread and equipment to make fabric. She is grateful for the support she is receiving from Kiva with her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena has been in the hog raising business for 15 years now. She needs to have income on her own, knowing her monthly income is not enough for her growing family.

Nena is 53 years old with children of adult age, and from Bolos, Siquijor. She is supported by Paglaum MPC in all of her financial needs, whether it is for business or for the tuition fees of her children.

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay the tuition fee for her son. Nena is grateful to the cooperative because she is supported throughout all.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and has five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 42 year old lady who is married and has four children and three of them attend school.
Alice is a teacher by profession but in order to increase her income she is also involved in selling agricultural produce especially cereals.

Alice has applied for a loan of three million(ugx3,000,000) to buy maize and expand her business which is her dream for the future. The maize is apparently selling cheaply and she will sell it at a profit.
The challenges that she faces are price fluctuations and high cost of transport.
She describes herself as hardworking and honest person in business and life.

loans.use: To boost her produce business by buying more stock of maize.

loans.name: Sheyla Maylin

texts.es:
Sheyla, es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Redes de Computadoras y Comunicación de Datos. Decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta mucho ya que se acomoda más a su personalidad y es una carrera de mucho futuro. Aún le faltan 2 años más para culminar su carrera. 

Ella siente que la carrera la beneficiará personalmente así como también a su familia, porque podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella le dedica 38 horas semanales a sus estudios. Cuando termine de estudiar ella piensa trabajar en una gran empresa de prestigio y donde pueda demostrar todas las habilidades aprendidas durante los 3 años que dura su carrera.

Debido a la difícil situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia, ella solicita el apoyo a KIVA para poder seguir pagando sus estudios y poder culminar sus estudios en el tiempo estimado; logrando convertirse en una excelente profesional.

Ella se siente muy feliz y emocionada al saber que existen otras personas en el mundo que podrán ayudarla a convertirse en una gran profesional, como siempre lo soñó. Es por eso, que les dedica unas palabras a KIVA: "Muchísimas gracias por su ayuda, gracias a esas personas tan buenas que confían en mi, porque saben que con esta ayuda podré salir adelante en mis estudios. Muchas gracias!!
texts.en:
Sheyla is a young woman who is studying Computer Networks and Data Communication. She decided to study this because she really likes it, since it goes well with her personality and is a field with great future potential. She has two years left to finish her studies.

She feels that this field of study will benefit her a great deal personally as well as benefit her family, since they will be able to have a better quality of life. She dedicates 38 hours per week to her studies. When she finishes studying, she hopes to work in a large, prestigious business where she can put to use all the skills she learned during the three years required of this degree.

Due to the difficult economic situation that her family is facing, she is requesting the support of Kiva in order to continue paying for her studies and to be able to finish her studies in the estimated amount of time, thus becoming an excellent professional. She feels very happy and excited to know that there are other people in the world who can help her become this great professional that she has always dreamed of becoming.

For these reasons, she has a few words she'd like to say to Kiva: "Thank you so much for your help, and thanks to those good people who believe in me because they know that with this help, I will be able to move forward with my studies. Thanks very much!"

loans.use: to pay off her debt for her studies in Computer Networks and Data Communication so that she will be able to work in a large business.

loans.name: Different Gender, Same Purpose In Life - N05K2Bđìnhbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mr Trung is 40 years old and he is married. He has had a manufacturing business making iron furniture for 7 years. Trung lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Trung faces is lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary items for his manufacturing iron process.
In 2014, Trung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. Trung has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
He is the group leader of "Different Gender, Same Purpose In Life - N05K2Bđìnhbsơn Group", which consists of 5 members.
With his business profit, Trung hopes for his business to do well, for his children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary things for his iron manufacturing process.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en: Genita is a sari-sari store owner. She is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with one adult son. Her husband is a buyer of animals. Genita and her husband works together to earn a living. In the future, she wants to expand her business to have a better means of living. As for now, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, sugar, spices, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk. Additionally, Genita is also engaged in buying and selling meat.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, sugar, spices, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk

loans.name: Sofania

texts.en:
Sofania works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines. Sofania has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

Sofania has been in this business for 28 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 21 years and earns more income from raising pigs and food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, pictured above, is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells solar products to rural communities in Kenya. She is 38 years old and has two children in secondary school. Since selling BrightBox, One Degree Solar’s solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios, Susan has been able to uplift her family as well as the livelihoods of her customers. Susan educates local communities, primary schools, and women’s groups on the benefits of solar and through her product demonstrations and training, she is improving the lives of thousands by providing access to sustainable energy products.

Through a Kiva loan, Susan will be able to purchase a further 100 solar kits, which will allow her to increase her inventory to serve more customers, scale her business, and earn more money for her family. Her long-term goal is to conduct training and live demonstrations across the entire Eastern Kenya region on the benefits of solar energy when compared to traditional energy sources, such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries. She is currently active on Kiva with another loan for 140 units of BrightBox.

loans.use: To receive and sell 100 units of BrightBox to both rural and urban end-users in Kenya.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan Miguel es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Juan Miguel tengo 17 años de edad resido en Santiago de los Caballeros, tengo dos hermanos menores, vivo con  mis padres, mi padre realiza la labor de zapatero mientras mi madre es profesora. Me gustaría realizar mis estudios universitarios en la “Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago”  UTESA”.  Desde temprana edad siento una gran pasión por la Medicina por lo que es la carrera que quiero estudiar y considero que puedo llegar a ser un muy buen Médico. Es la primera ocasión que pienso ingresar a la universidad por lo que sería mi iniciación en carrera.
Este préstamo para mí es muy importante ya que del mismo depende que yo pueda dar inicio a la carrera que tanto deseo. De no recibir el préstamo seguiría intentando hasta lograrlo ya que del mismo depende la realización de mis estudios universitarios; así mismo me afectaría bastante ya que mis padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para costear mi carrera universitaria, puesto que, en nuestra sociedad, hay un alto costo para satisfacer las necesidades familiares en todos los aspectos y sobre todo, en la educación. Así mismo si no consiguiera este préstamo se prolongarían mis sueños ya que tendría que buscar la forma de trabajar y estudiar, de modo que, al realizar ambas cosas le dedicaría menos tiempo a mis estudios, extendiendo mis sueños de ser un profesional de la Medicina a muy largo plazo.
Mis metas académicas son: lograr ser un excelente médico, ayudar a mis padres que tanto se han esforzado en sacarme hacia delante a mis hermanos y a mí y de esa manera poder ayudarles también a cumplir el sueño de mis hermanos como yo quiero cumplir el mío con la ayuda de Dios. Al terminar mi carrera quiero especializarme para ser un cirujano plástico. Mi área favorita de Medicina es la Cirugía Plástica y siempre he anhelado mediante ésta poder ayudar a las personas más necesitadas que requieren de este servicio.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is a young medical student. He's requesting a loan to cover his educational expenses. This is his history:

"My name is Juan Miguel. I am 17 years old and I live in Santiago de los Caballeros. I have two younger siblings and I live with my parents. My father's a cobbler and my mother's a teacher.

"I would like to attend college at UTESA, the Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago. I have had a passion for medicine from a very young age, so it's the field I want to study. I feel I can become a very good doctor. This is the first time I have planned to enroll in a university, so it would be the start of my program.

"This loan is very important to me because whether I can start studying the field I so want to depends on it. If I didn't get the loan I would keep on trying until I succeeded, because going to college depends on it. It would also affect me a lot because my parents don't have the necessary money to pay for my college education, because in our society it's very expensive to satisfy all of a family's needs and especially for education. Also, if I didn't get this loan my dreams would be put on hold because I'd have to look for a way to work and go to school, and doing both things I would devote less time to my studies, making my dream of being a medical professional a long-term goal.

"My academic goals are: to become an excellent doctor; to help my parents, who have worked so hard to get my siblings and me ahead; and to help them achieve my siblings' dreams just as I want to achieve mine, with God's help.

"When I finish my program I want to specialize in plastic surgery. My favorite field of medicine is plastic surgery, which I have always seen as a way to help more needy people who need this service."

loans.use: to cover his higher education expenses

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: Aged 44, Hen resides in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She has four children, two of whom are dependent children and only one is in school. To support her family’s living, Hen has grown rice as the primary source of income for more than five years. She is also working for a labor fee and catching fish to earn additional income. She can earn income of about 12 USD per day. Because of drought, her rice did not grow well and returned her a lower income than before. Because of having not enough working capital to do farming for this season, Hen is now forming a group of two to get a new loan, which will be her fourth cycle with VisionFund. She repaid her past loans completely. Based on the previous loans, she improved her living standards and having enough household consumption to support her family. With this new loan, she will manage it to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to grow her crop well. Hen hopes that her cash crops produce good outputs for her so that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield in order to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Funny Mommy - N07Mđứcmlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 4 years. Tình lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Tình faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

Tình joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the N07MĐứcMLộc, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Evame

texts.en:
Evame is 17 years old who is currently enrolled on the course of BSc. in Secondary Education. She is supported by her farmer parents. She is fully aware of the poverty her family is experiencing. To ease the burden of her family, she took a part time job so that she can provide for her other needs, without the expense of asking an amount from her parents.

Evame also sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and availed the loan program intended for college students like her. She loan an amount of PHP 15,000.00 to pay for tuition and other school fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and school fees for her BSc. in Secondary Education.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 28-year-old habal-habal driver from Trinidad, Bohol. Habal-habal is a transportation service, using a motorcycle, in the most remote villages in the Philippines.

Rogelio also sells gasoline to earn a living. He works hard because of his 8-month-old son's needs. He is asking for a loan so he can further increase his stocks of gasoline to sell to his fellow drivers. His income will be used for food, milk, and diapers for his baby.

In the future, Rogelio plans to send his child to school for his brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a studio where he offers photography services and video production, in which he has been involved for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy photography materials. His business goal is to have a great studio within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy photography materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 65 years old, a widow with 8 adult age children. She is the retired Chief of Police in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She had served the National Police for 30 straight years, with due honesty and dedication. Elena, though rearing her children alone, has raised them well and sent all of them to school until they finished college.

Now that her grand children are starting to enter college, she wants to be of great help to them by sending them to school using her monthly pension that she receives. She accessed the financial loan program of Paglaum MPC and borrowed an amount of PHP 50,000.00 to pay for tuition fees and other school fees of her grand daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and other school fees of her grand daughter

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Miguela. She is 72 years old and hails from Las Pinas City, Philippines. Ever since her husband died, she dedicated herself to raising her children, and she is thankful to God that they now have their own families. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life, but with her faith and perseverance she came out of it victorious. She is now enjoying the presence of her grandchildren.

Miguela has been blessed with a small general store for 10 years already. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all of these products are essential food and household items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from her first customers since she started her store, it is now serving more as the population grew in her community. 

To help her sustain and grow her store, she is seeking a PHP 30,000 loan to fill her small store with more food items such as rice, frozen foods, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, etc. so she can compete well with other general stores nearby. Although she sometimes encounters difficulty in collecting receivables from some of her customers, she maintains the positive outlook that God will supply all their needs.

Miguela's precious dream is to see her grandchildren grow up and finish their studies. She always prays for a good and loving family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 55 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Hilda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Hilda has been raising pigs for ten years and earns additional income from charcoal retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Tessie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase capital to boost her goat trade business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Adene

texts.pt:
O Senhor Adene vive na casa própria com a sua esposa e três filhos menores de idade. Com o presente empréstimo ele pretende dar continuidade com a sua obra fazendo a compra de material de construção (cimento, pedras, ferro, areia fina e grossa). 
Ele é supervisor e sonha em progredir profissionalmente.
Tem dificuldades financeiras para construir a sua propria casa e cuidar da familia pelo que pagará o presente emprestimo sem entrar em moras de modo a se beneficiar dos posteriores.
texts.en:
Adene lives in a house that he owns with his wife and three small children. He wants to use this loan to continue building his home by buying construction materials (cement, stone, iron, coarse and fine sand). 
He is supervising the works and his dream is to succeed professionally.
His has financial difficulties to finish building his home and take care of this family, so he will repay this loan on time in order to make sure he has access to future loans as well.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, stone, iron, coarse and fine sand).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and bricks to complete finishing touches to the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional clothes and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
O cliente Mário de 61anos de idade, casado, trabalhador como operador,  pai de 7 filhos dos quais 5 são maiores de idade e independentes, 2 frequentam o ensino primário, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, ferros, cimento, pedra, pregos, arame, barrotes chapas de zinco para dar continuidade da sua obra construindo uma cozinha e a casa de banho .
O cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, construir dependências em sua casa para aumentar a renda familiar .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Mario is 61 years old and married. He works as a machine operator and is the father of seven children; five of them are independent adults and the remaining two go to primary school. He owns the house where he lives.

With the requested amount, he is planning to buy iron, cement, gravel, nails, wire, beams, and zinc sheets to continue building a kitchen and a bathroom.

His dream is to finish building his house and offer his family a better home, and build rooms to rent in order to increase the family’s income.

His main challenges are financial in nature. He has continued working and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, gravel, nails, wire, beams and zinc sheets to build a kitchen and a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cookies, rice, sugar, and vegetable oil, and enlarge her store in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
A Senhora Arminda vive na casa própria com seu filho, nora e dois netos. É comerciante de mariscos (peixe pedra, serra, pescadinha, corvina, camarão e lulas). Com o presente emprestimo ela pretende aumentar o seu volume do negócio comprando peixe diverso. 
Tem como sonho abrir um quiosque na vila de Marracuene e dadas as dificuldades financeiras irá sempre contar com o crédito para concretizar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
