Arminda lives in a house that she owns with her son, her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. She sells seafood (stone fish, sawfish, weakfish, corvina, shrimp and calamari). With this loan she wants to increase her stock by buying a larger variety of fish.
Her dream is to open a booth in the town of Marracuene, but due to her financial difficulties she will always rely on these loans to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy different fish varieties

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado “Mujeres Guapas”, ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y sacrificadas que se unieron para poder crecer y salir adelante a través del trabajo en equipo.
La Sra. Nilsa, una de las integrantes, solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros, para poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Nilsa se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de si para poder mejorar su emprendimiento que con tanto esfuerzo pudo montar.
Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
Fifteen women compose this group, called "Mujeres Guapas". They are very courageous and unselfish women, who joined together in order to be able to grow and get ahead through teamwork.

Señora Nilsa, one of the members, is requesting the loan for the purchase of various garments to sell, such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, and others, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. Nilsa stands out for being a very hardworking person, who puts all of herself into improving her business, that she was able to start with such great effort.

She is thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to purchase various garments to sell, such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, and others.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
O cliente Jeremias de 33 anos de idade, casado, trabalhador,  pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, feijão, saco de amendoim, massa polana, massa bela,  para reforçar o seu negocio .
A cliente tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, ser um grande empresário  e contrair o matrimonio.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Jeremias is 33 years old and married. He is a working man and the father of two children; one of them goes to primary school and the other one is not yet of school age. He owns the house where he lives.

With the requested amount, he is planning to buy beans, bags of peanuts, and two different brands of pasta, and in this way strengthen his business.

His dream is to expand his business and fulfill his customers’ needs, become a great businessman, and get married.

His main challenges are financial in nature. He has continued working and is planning to apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy beans, peanut bags, and different brands of pasta to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Moura

texts.pt: O senhor Moura, vive com a esposa, quatro filhos e a mãe. É Vigilante, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, chapas, cantoneira, ferros e pagar a mão de obra para o fabrico de portões principais da sua casa. Tem sonho de construir uma outra casa e deixar a primeira com os filhos e casa oficialmente. Tem como maior desafio pagar bem o empréstimo e trabalhar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Moura lives with his wife, their four children and his mother. He is a security guard and he wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as metal sheets, draywall, iron rods and pay for manual labor to build the main fance in his home. 
His dream is to be able to build a second home, so he can leave the first to his children and get married officially.
His biggest goal is to repay this loan on time and be able to work more and more.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, draywall, iron rods and pay for manual labor to build the main fance in his home.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.pt: O Sr Domingos é tecnico administrativo de profissão,casado e pai de 3 filhos  menores e vão a escola,o Sr Domingos  sentiu uma necessidade de ter que recorrer a um emprestimo devido ao baixo salario e custo elevado do material de construção para fazer concretizar com seus planos de reabiliar sua casa,este é o segundo emprestimo na hluvuku e com o dinheiro do mesmo vai comprar loiça sanitaria,varões de ferro,cimento e tubos de canalização.O seu maior sonho é tornar se auto dependente tornando se um empresario de sucesso.O seu maior desafio é suatentar os estudos dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Domingos is an administrative technician by profession. He is married with three young children who are in school. Domingos felt he needed to take out a loan in order to make his plans to renovate his house a reality, because of his own low salary and the high cost of construction material.

This is Domingos' second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner]. He plans to use the money from this loan to buy bathroom tiles, iron bars, cement, and pipes for plumbing. One of his main goals for the future is to become a successful independent businessman. One of his main challenges is keeping his children in school.

loans.use: to buy bathroom tiles, iron bars, cement, and plumbing materials.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Direct-selling business is common in the Philippines, especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the lack of family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into the direct selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then the entrepreneur or direct-selling representative will just enhance the business by expanding her network of target customers and proper rolling of capital.

Milagros of Tigbauan, Iloilo is a direct selling representative who sells products from notable companies such as Avon, Personal Collection and Beautiful Horizon. She is married to Edgardo and they have children who are already raising their own families.

Milagros still aspires to improve her business because it’s her desire to extend help to her grandchildren. Indeed, the responsibilities of a loving mother/grandmother don’t cease. With the aid of additional capital amounting to PhP 10,000, Milagros will buy more personal and home products, including clothes, shoes and bags. She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to support her grandchildren. Her dream is to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. She also wishes to have a vacation abroad together with her family.

Milagros meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more personal and home products for resale, including clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
A “sari-sari” or variety store appeals to customers if it has a wide variety of selections. This is the reason why Elsie wants to avail herself of a PHP 10,000 loan to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods in volume. This additional stock will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Fatima, General Santos City.

If her sari-sari will grow bigger according to her plan, its income can efficiently meet her family’s basic needs and the school expenses of their child who is studying in high school. She was able to support her eldest child, who is already working. She is lovingly supported by her husband Romeo, a driver. They both work diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future.
 
Elsie meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods in volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new solar system to generate more power with his already installed system. With this he and his family will be able to have 4 light bulbs and connect a radio device.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
This is Oscar; he is 64 years old and married to Delilah, 63 years old, and they have grown up children. They are survivors of Typhoon Haiyan that swept the Philippines, especially the Visayas region in November 2013. Oscar runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Tigbauan, Iloilo and he continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from his store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Aside from this, he has some neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes few days or weeks before they pay. The stability of his business is shaken by this practice because it depletes his capital.

He is a considerate person who cannot refuse his neighbors, but he also has to earn enough money for their everyday needs and save some amount for their retirement. Self-employed citizens in the Philippines, especially in some remote areas, have no pension or medical benefits when they retire. They have to rely on their own savings or help from other people. Considering this, Oscar needs to improve his business.

He plans to buy more supplies, particularly soft drinks, beverages, and grocery items. He is requesting additional capital of PHP 30,000 that will surely boost his income and savings. He’s praying for your generous support and wishes for more blessings to come your way. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies particularly soft drinks, beverages, and grocery items.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Nada lives with her only child in Chouf, Lebanon. She has been practicing lace making as a hobby since she was young, but she started selling her products 10 years ago in her neighborhood; then she expanded her network to a larger area. Her clients see her as an ambitious and hardworking woman and appreciate her honesty and professionalism.

Her husband works abroad as a farmer and sends money to his family on a monthly basis to provide them with the best possible living conditions. Her son is 25 and he supports his parents financially too, by working as a building janitor.

In order to buy new lace making tools to improve her products' quality and increase her income, Nada is asking, for the first time, for a loan of 1,543,658 LBP (Lebanese pounds) through Kiva's partner Ibdaa. In such a way, her clients will be more satisfied with the products and she will improve her family's living conditions by enabling her son to start planning his own future.

loans.use: to buy lace making tools

loans.name: Linnet

texts.en:
Linnet, pictured above, has a strong passion for One Degree Solar and the BrightBox. Linnet is 40 years old and lives with her two daughters, who she is very close with. Linnet has a strong passion for the renewable energy sector, as she wants to see a Kenya where kerosene is non-existent and her children can live in a less polluted community. Not only does Linnet want to sell One Degree Solar products, but she also wants to educate as much of the community as she can about the benefits of using solar products, as she feels education and raising awareness on solar is the best way to help eradicate kerosene. 

Through a Kiva loan, Linnet will be able to purchase 100 solar kits, which will allow her to increase her inventory to serve more customers, providing solar solutions to as many people as possible. Linnet is a trusted member of her community and One Degree Solar sees tremendous potential in her ability to sell and be a great brand ambassador for BrightBox and future products.

loans.use: to receive and sell 100 units of BrightBox to both rural and urban end-users in Kenya.

loans.name: Flor De Chupol Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Chupol” with its 11 dedicated small-business women is located in the colorful and majestic city of Chichicastenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The area is filled with beautiful flowers that are reflected in the embroidered necklines of the traditional huipiles (blouses) worn by the local Maya women and treasured by textile collectors. For the most part, the members of the group hand embroider the “huipiles” (blouses) and “fajas” (belts) with brilliantly colored flowers and birds.

The women of “Flor de Chupol” are requesting their second loan from Kiva investors, as they have successfully and fully paid off their first one. The women of “Flor de Chupol” are very happy at the thought of being able to begin a new loan cycle. They are looking forward to increasing their inventories in order to increase their incomes.

The youngest of the group is Maria, who is 23 years old and has had only two years of formal education. However, the lack of a formal education has not stopped her from moving forward. In order to succeed financially, Maria began a business making the traditional blouses or “huipiles”. In fact, her “huipiles” are in such demand that she has had to employ five women! Their beautiful textiles are being sold in two areas outside of their community. Maria is asking for a new loan in order to fulfill the increased demand, but also to generate more income and be able to buy high quality fabric, as well as high quality multi-colored threads. Maria’s goal is to be able to hire more women to help them all move out of a state of poverty and become strong and empowered like she is. She knows that this will be of great benefit to them and their community.

Each month, Maria and her friends in the Trust Bank attend their Trust Bank meeting and after transacting business on their loans, they participate in games and role-playing on a particular useful subject. Maria and the ladies in the “Flor de Chapol” Trust Bank thank KIVA investors from throughout the world for their support and generosity. All the women in the group and their employees face a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy high quality fabric, as well as high quality multi-colored threads for her textile business.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en ciudad del Este, las integrantes son mujeres muy emprendedoras que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maricela, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene un humilde trabajo de venta de ropas, es muy buena vendedora y comenta que le está yendo muy bien gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas para la venta, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed in Ciudad del Este. The members are very enterprising women who want to help their loved ones by working together, and through the elimination of poverty program.

One of the members is Señora Maricela, who works in sales. She has a humble occupation, selling clothing. She is a very good saleslady, and she comments that it is going very well for her because of her work and sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of various garments to sell, such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, and others. In this way, she can continue with her business, and continue helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase various garments to sell, such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, and others.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Mary Jane’s perseverance. Wanting to see them with a college diploma, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store business. She dreams of better living conditions for her whole family someday.

Mary Jane resides in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte with her husband Candelario, a driver, and their three children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient for their everyday expenditures, thus she decided to operate a variety store that sells various commodities. Profit from her business partially sustains her family’s expenses, but her children’s education is still a big problem. Also her husband’s brother asked for financial assistance just recently, and they extended help to the extent of sacrificing their everyday sustenance.

She desires to gain more profit so she can save better and efficiently prepare for her children’s educational needs. To improve her business, she asks for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy stocks of items to sell in her variety store. She also sets aside some savings to buy a refrigerator so she can sell soft drinks and other beverages. In the long run, she hopes to renovate her house and build a bigger structure for her store.

Mary Jane meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: Ruth vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y atol de elote, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, su madre fue quien le enseño esa actividad y gracias a ello es como ha podido salir adelente, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de elotes por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in her own house with her two children and earns a living selling tamales and atol de elote (a corn based drink), a job which she has done for the last 20 years. Her mother was the person that taught her the job and as a result she has been able to get by.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy wholesale corn which will enable her to continue with her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Maria Armi

texts.en:
Generally, Filipinos are capable of handling well many of life’s adversities. They are like bamboo trees which are bent but not broken. They gather strength in camaraderie and togetherness. This 55-year-old entrepreneur is Maria Armi from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. Her husband died several years ago, but she didn’t give in to emotional troubles. Instead she focuses her attention on her children, and together they move on from the loss of the head of the family. Maria Armi also finds encouragement from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

Maria Armi is pursuing her food processing business so she can continue supporting the college expenses of her youngest child. Her older children were able to finish schooling with the aid of her business. She prepares desserts such as rice cake, brownies, and tarts. She sells rhem to her neighbors and friends, offers them to schools and workplaces, and she also accepts bulk orders during special occasions.

She wants to increase her production and sales with the help of PHP 15,000 additional capital. She will buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, and butter plus materials like styro, disposable containers, spoons and forks. Later on, she will also buy additional cooking tools like a steamer and an oven. Her dream is to put up a refreshment parlor in the future and reward herself and her children with memorable travels in beautiful places.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, and butter plus materials like styro, disposable containers, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en: Justin is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows, sheep and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nkundamahoro Group

texts.en:
NKUNDAMAHORO is a group led by Chantal, who is 50 years old. The group name means “Love Peace” in English. She is married and has 7 children aged between 7 and 21 years.

Chantal sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 30 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more cassava for selling. The profits from the business will be used to buy goats and cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sell

loans.name: Tito Santiago

texts.es:
Tito, considera necesario invertir nuevamente en su negocio para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, el crédito que solicita lo utilizara para comprar un lote de hamacas y lazos para tener un mejor inventario y ofrecer precios competitivos en el mercado.
Está satisfecho por los resultados positivos al haber administrado muy bien el financiamiento anterior y las ganancias, la cartera de clientes es más grande, ha dado empleo a otra persona que le ayuda a distribuir sus productos y tiene estabilidad económica, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas en seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Tito considers it is necessary to invest again in his business to meet his customers demands. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy hammocks and ties in bulk to have a greater inventory and offer competitive prices in the market.

He is satisfied with the positive results he received from having administer well the previous loan he received and the profit he made. His customer base is larger, he employed a person to help him distribute his products and he has financial stability. To this day, he has not had any problems in continuing his work.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks and ties in bulk to have a better inventory and offer competitive prices in the market.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is Anna, a farmer from Goris town. Anna lives with her husband and two daughters and has been involved in farming activities for many years. Anna's farm includes a pig, piglets, hens and bees. She also cultivates haricots, potatoes and tomatoes in the nearby yard of their house. Anna's family members are a big support for organizing all of the farming work and keeping the farm sustainable.

Anna has now applied for this loan to purchase some fertilizer and seeds and to pay for partial renovation of her greenhouse. She has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, Anna and her family were able to make the farm profitable to cover monthly payments.

Anna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. Please help this hard-working and nice woman to prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and partial renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a teacher with almost 21 years of experience working with children. She teaches history in the local school in Sisian town and also provides individual classes to students from her house.
She prepares her students for entrance exams and works hard to help them achieve success. Raisa asks lenders to help her with purchasing a laptop, printer, chairs and a table needed for her classes.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So the support of lenders is very important for Raisa and she hopes for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop, printer, chairs and a table needed for providing classes to students in the house.

loans.name: Miguel Guillermo

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven estudiante de la ciudad de Arequipa. La carrera que eligió estudiar es Mecánica Automotriz, porque le agrada mucho desde pequeño y también es una carrera con gran demanda laboral. Aún le faltan 2 años para culminar su carrera, la cual la beneficiará por ser una fuente segura de ingresos económicos, y así podrá apoyar económicamente a su familia. 

Él sueña con trabajar en una importante empresa minera, porque la calidad de trabajo es mejor y la remuneración económica también. El problema que tiene actualmente es que su familia no cuenta con muchos ingresos económicos, lo que pone en riesgo la continuidad de su carrera. Es por ese motivo que, él recurre al apoyo de KIVA para solicitar un préstamo que le permita cancelar sus pensiones y así pueda culminar su carrera con un buen nivel profesional.

Miguel se siente muy agradecido y entusiasmado con muchas ganas de seguir capacitándose, entregando lo mejor de él y no decepcionar aquellas personas que lo están apoyando y creen en él. Es por ello, que quiere dedicarles unas palabras a los integrantes de KIVA: "Quiero agradecerles por esta oportunidad y decirles que hacen una gran labor al apoyarlo con este préstamo. Les prometo que daré todo mi esfuerzo para no decepcionarlos."
texts.en:
Miguel is a young student in the city of Arequipa. The career that he selected is Automotive Mechanic because he has liked it ever since he was young. It is also a career in high demand. He still has two more years to finish his degree, which will help him by being a secure source of income. This way he will be able to support his family economically. He dreams of working for an important mining company because the quality of work is better and the compensation is also.

The problem that he has presently is that his family doesn't have much income, which puts the continuation of his studies at risk. For this reason he is turning to KIVA to ask for a loan that will allow him to cover his expenses and be able to finish his degree at a professional level.

Miguel is very grateful and enthusiastic. He has the drive to continue working to his capacity, giving his all and not letting down those people who support him and believe in him. For this reason he wants to dedicate a few words to the members of KIVA: "I want to thank you for this opportunity and tell you that you are making a great thing by supporting me with this loan. I promise you that I will give all of my effort to not let you down."

loans.use: to settle the expenses of Automotive Mechanic courses and become an excellent professional.  .

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Kosal’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kosal makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a seller by selling fish at the market to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these individuals to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to have enough power to have light after sunset and to connect low energy-consuming electrical devices.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is one of the farmers who lives in a share-land called El Encanto. El Encanto is located in the Mexican state of Campeche, which is one of the Mexican states with a higher poverty rate. Daniel lives with his wife and children in a small house made of wood and aluminum. He works hard to give better life conditions to his family. Daniel as other members of the share-land works daily in the cornfield and he earns the minimum Mexican Salary (around 120 USD per month). A year ago Daniel spent around 9 USD per month in buying candles, which he and his family used as light source. Candles were a deficient light source and breathing the candle smoke had repercussions on Daniel's family' health. To improve their life conditions, the Mexican government gave some of the residents of El Encanto solar systems to have light in the night and to stop consuming harmful light sources. Nowadays, Daniel wants to purchase a new solar system to increase the power generated by the already installed system. With two solar systems Daniel's family would be able to connect a radio and a blender to make juice and sell it in the share-land.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to increase the power generated by the solar panel he already has and with this have a new productive opportunity.

loans.name: Fatimatu

texts.en:
Fatimatu is sixty-seven years of age. She is a tenant at Mamobi. There is no toilet facility in the house she has rented so she and the tenants use the commercial toilet facilty in the community. She consulted the other tenants about the need for them to have a toilet facility in the house and they all agreed to that and informed the landlord and who lives elsewhere and he has also given his concert. 

With this loan, Fatimatu will be able to put up a modern toilet facility in the house.She will repay the loan through contributions from the tenants.

loans.use: to put up a modern toilet facility for her family and tenants.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
For 11 years, Flordeliza has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Fatima, General Santos City. She receives tips on how to manage her variety store and retailing of rice and corn. Her store is slowly developing into a mini-grocery with the help of her husband, Pepito.

They sell various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, condiments, beverages and many others. Simultaneously they buy sacks of rice and corn, then sell these cereals as part of the store inventory. They really work hard in order to sustain the family’s financial resources. 

Flordeliza wants to continue what they have started. She aims to fulfill her dream of running a grocery store in the near future. For now, she would like to avail herself of a loan worth PHP 50,000. She would be very grateful if it would be granted soon, because then she could acquire dry goods, beverages, and sacks of rice and corn in volume.

She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy dry goods, beverages, and sacks of rice and corn in volume

loans.name: Jamidah

texts.en: Jamidah is a 32-year-old hardworking married woman. She has five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In order to raise enough income to support her growing family, she decided to venture into food selling. She also grows and sells cocoa to supplement her monthly earnings. Given the perishable nature of the business, she lacks the appropriate refrigeration equipment to purchase in bulk. Her dream is to own the biggest food store in town and also to build a good residential house. Her business has been able to serve a number of her community members and restaurants. She is proud of it, despite challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Jamidah is requesting a loan to buy food items like tomatoes, cabbage, rice, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy food items like tomatoes, cabbage, rice, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Anifa is an inspiring woman living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She grows cocoa in order to raise money to support her children since she is a single mother. With her meager earnings she has been able to pay school fees for her children, build a house and buy more land for farming. In order to generate daily income she also trades in fish and buys cocoa from other farmers and sells at a profit. 

She is hopeful that her business will break even soon and she will be able to expand given the high demand for fish and cocoa in the area. Her desire is to educate her children up to university since she never got a chance to further her studies and increase her business. Anifa intends to use the loan to buy cocoa and fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and fish to sell.

loans.name: Recheal

texts.en: Recheal is a 23-year-old married lady with two children. She is a resident of Bundibugyo district, Uganda. For five years she has been growing cocoa and this has been her major source of income. After realizing that her yields can not sufficiently meet her demand, she decided to buy cocoa from other farmers and sell at a profit and the business is very lucrative. Inadequate capital to expand her business and unpredictable weather changes affect her business, but her dream is to become one of the largest traders and growers of cocoa. Recheal is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Adolyat

texts.ru: Адолят рада на Вашу помощь. Она до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свою любимую работу. Ей скоро исполнится 64. Но она не хочет, бросит свою работу. С помощью этой профессии Адолят зарабатывает на жизнь.  Адолят решила отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. У нее не получилось собрать денег для ремонта, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Адолят верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Adolyat is happy for your help. She continues her beloved work to this day. She will soon turn 64 years old, but she does not want to quit her work. With the help of her profession, Adolyat earns a living.

Adolyat decided to renovate her home and improve her family's living conditions. She did not manage to save money for the renovation and decided to apply for a loan. Adolyat believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barnyard animals and raw materials to make traditional weavings to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Janet is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell for her business selling used clothing.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is married with six children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa, but also buys from other farmers in order to meet the high demand of her customers as a cocoa trader, and she has been in business now for two years.

She is a very hardworking lady with future plans of supporting her family through the selling and buying of cocoa and gets additional income from selling cassava flour in the markets. She faces a challenge of seasonality of the cocoa. In some seasons there is increased production and other season’s low production, which causes price changes. She hopes that through her hard work, she will be able to expand her business. Scovia intends to use the loan to buy cocoa and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon es un empresario independiente de 34 años que reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla. Su taller de Ebanistería está ubicado en esta misma localidad y se vinculó en esta actividad por la propuesta de un amigo con quien celebró una sociedad a pesar de su desconocimiento en la labor; al poco tiempo Jhon había sido estafado por su socio, sin embargo decidió continuar en el negocio trabajando de la mano de un colaborador y así logro sacar adelante su primera producción de muebles que envió a Cartagena de Indias para su distribución.  En la actualidad cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento y seis trabajadores fijos y en las épocas de mayor demanda contrata tres ocasionales, como su propósito es continuar creciendo en su negocio es necesario que cuente con las herramientas necesarias para producir con estándares de calidad y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una maquina industrial para cortar madera y materia prima.  Esta inversión pretende mejorar los tiempos de entrega y la capacidad de producción. Su meta a futuro es conseguir un contrato con empresas grandes y adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Jhon is an independent businessman, 34 years old who lives with his spouse and two young children in a neighborhood south of Barranquilla. His cabinet making shop is located in the same place. He started this work at the proposal of a friend with whom he had a relationship despite his lack of knowledge of the job. In a short time, Jhon had been swindled by his partner, but decided to continue the work. He collaborated with someone and was able to produce his first production of furniture which he sent to Cartagena de Indias for distribution.

Presently he has three years of experience and six workers. In times of high demand he contracts another three employees, as his goal is to continue growing. In his business it is necessary to have the necessary tools to produce to quality standards.

He is asking for his first credikiva through the Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in an industrial machine to cut wood and materials. This investment will improve his busy times and his production capacity. His future goal is to get a contract with large companies and acquire his own home.

loans.use: to invest in an industrial machine to cut wood and raw materials.

loans.name: Milida

texts.en: Milida is an enterprising woman living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is a trader dealing in agricultural produce specifically beans and cocoa and the business is very lucrative. With the money that she has been earning she has been able to pay school fees for her children and meet other basic needs for her family. Unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital are her greatest challenges and her desire is to own a food store that can meet the high demand. Milida is seeking for a loan to buy cocoa and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and beans to sell.

loans.name: Abegen

texts.en:
Abegen works hard to support her family. Abegen is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Abegen has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Abegen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nelina

texts.en:
Nelina works hard to support her family. Nelina is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and paints for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nelina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paints for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and motorcycle transport.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase addititional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rwensenene Kweterana Group

texts.en: Catherine is a 45-year-old married lady with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and at the same time is a farmer growing food crops like cassava and sweet potatoes to sell. She is faced with challenges of limited capital and unpredictable price changes which hinder expansion of her business. She has future prospects of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. She has asked for a loan with her fellow group members of Rwensenene Kweterana Group, who have guaranteed each other to help her buy more sugar, cooking oil, salt and posho to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil, salt and posho to sell.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a bar where she sells soda, beer and water and her customers are so fond of her because of her good personality. She is an enterprising woman who also trades in produce in order to raise enough money to support her family. High taxes and the cost of rent affect her business and her dream is to build her own business premises. Peluce is seeking a loan to buy beer, soda and water to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and water to sell.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 25-year-old, hardworking married lady who is charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child and attends school in Hoima, Uganda.

She ventured into the selling of general merchandise such as salt, cooking oil, and sugar, among other items, on a retail basis so as to raise income to support her family. On realizing a need to increase her income further, Zubeda carries out farming, where she grows mainly cassava and beans. She has always aspired to educate her children up to a degree level as well as extending her retail services nearer to the people.

Zubeda is faced with the challenge of limitation of capital. Zubeda is requesting a loan to buy more stock items like sugar, salt, and soap to sell on a retail basis.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt, and soap to sell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Kayombo  Central Group

texts.en:
Jadress is a thirty-four-year-old hardworking married female with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a member of Kayombo Central Group in Kamwenge, Uganda. This group started by supporting each other by digging in one homestead per day. With time they organized themselves and started up businesses. Jadress owns a bar where she earns most of her income, which she supplements with income from a ladies' beauty salon. Her dream is to educate all her children and expand her business into a modern bar. She is faced with a challenge of competition from other traders.

She is requesting a loan to buy crates of beer and soda to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 57 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos de 13, 15 y 19 años de edad, es un hombre de trabajo, aprendió a trabajar la agricultura para sobrevivir, anteriormente realizaba viajes hasta otros departamentos y también trabajada en la siembra de maíz y frijol.

Marcos, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos en esta temporada.

Marcos, sueña con obtener una buena cosecha de esta siembra que realice.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 57, is married and has three children: 13, 15 and 19 years old. He is a working man. He learned to work in agriculture to survive. Previously he traveled to other departments (regions) and also worked in the sowing of corn and beans.

Marcos needs the money from the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to sow basic grains this season.

Marcos dreams of having a good crop from this planting that he is planning.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.en: Maximiliano is a farmer who works in a cornfield and earns the minimum Mexican salary (around 120 USD per month). Maximiliano lives in El Encanto, which is a share-land located in the Mexican state of Campeche. This Mexican state is recognized as one of the poorest states, where people living in communities lack access to basic services such as electricity. Maximiliano got a solar system to improve his family's life conditions and now he wants to increase the power generated by adding a new solar system. With the increase in the power generated, Maximiliano's family will be able to turn on the 2 light bulbs they have for more hours and will be able to connect a small fan. Campeche is a state with a warm climate, so having a fan will represent a “luxury” for Maximiliano's family.

loans.use: to improve his family's life conditions by purchasing a new solar system to increase the power generated by his already installed system.

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.ru: Исломиддин молодой и шустрый парень из Кабадиянского района. Ему 34 года. Исломиддин  занимается сельским хозяйством. Этим он обеспечивает свою семью. Сейчас Исломиддин хочет начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства, однако для покупки животных у него недостаточно денег. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом.  За счет кредита Исломиддин хочет приобрести несколько голов скотов для открытия своего бизнеса. Он надеется на Вашу поддержу.
texts.en:
Islomiddin is a young and smart guy from the Qubadiyon region. He is 34 years old. Islomiddin works with agriculture. He provides for his family this way.

Currently Islomiddin would like to start a new business of livestock breeding. He does however not have enough money to purchase livestock. Therefore he applied for a loan. Using the loan, Islomiddin would like to purchase some heads of livestock in order to start a business. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and start a new business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Running a variety store is a common enterprise in the Philippines. The proliferation of this type of business makes for stiff competition. Store owners try many techniques to make theirs stable and competitive. Rosalia, 40 years old, from Fatima, General Santos City, adds rice and corn to her inventory.

She also sells ready-to-wear apparel from house to house and operates a small internet café that she started just recently. She’s doing it all for the sake of her five children. She manages her businesses properly to provide for their daily expenditures and educational expenses.

She aspires to improve her business even more; hence she wants to avail herself of a PHP 10,000 loan to pay for additional grocery items and beverages. She also plans to add fruits to her inventory. 

In due time, she hopes that her businesses will progress and will give her family a comfortable life. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is positive that the children of a security guard and a small store owner can also obtain a college degree. This goal fuels her to properly manage her variety store and save little by little in order to expand her business and become a wholesaler of goods in their area in Fatima, General Santos City. Her husband, Ralph, is a security guard who also works hard to supply their needs. 

The people in Elsie's community are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them because she understands that it’s not always easy to earn money. But long-time debts deplete her capital and affect her family’s everyday sustenance. She’s very considerate to her neighbors but she also has to sustain her business.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PHP 30,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items for her inventory. It will stabilize her business and improve her profit despite many debtors in her store. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.

Elsie is working towards the completion of her children’s education and renovation of her house. She upholds CCT Credit Cooperative’s objective to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her inventory

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old, married and has five children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lorna requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorna has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilezers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat spices, eggs, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant business.

Lelita has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat spices, eggs, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.fr: Sivavughirana est un entrepreneur, propriétaire d’une boutique, organise un service de lavage des motos, secrétaire du groupe solidaire «Hope», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgé de 30 ans et qui est encore célibataire. Il va acheter une moto pour faire le taxi et s’approvisionner en 40 téléphones pour renforcer ses activités.  Il commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son salaire, il ya trois ans. Au final, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable
texts.en:
Sivavughirana is a businessman and the owner of a shop. He runs a motorbike washing service and is the secretary of the Hope Group, a client of the field partner Hekima. He is 30 years old and is still single.

He will purchase a motorbike to use as a taxi and purchase a supply of 40 telephones to strengthen his businesses.

He started his businesses with funds he made from his salary three years ago. Finally, he would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides to unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to drive as a taxi and to purchase a supply of 40 telephones in order to strengthen his businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pesticides for her coffee garden

loans.name: Kicheche Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en: Jane is a 43-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a member of Kicheche Tukore Hamwe Group. She operates a retail shop which she supplements with crop farming to cater for her family. Her vision is to expand her business and have all her children educated but her main setback is bad weather that affects the level of output from her garden. This group has remained united and its members have embarked on educating their children. Jane will use the loan facility to buy more, salt, rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more, salt, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru: 21 летняя красивая девушка Рохила. Она из города Турсунзаде. Рохила замужем и мать двоих детей. Она проживает вместе мужем и детьми. Рохила молодая, привлекательная и шустрая швея. Она 3 года занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Рохила просит кредит для купли стройматериалы для ремонта дома. Она хочет улучшить жилищные условия своих детей. По этой причине она просит кредит. Рохила нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This 21 years old, beautiful girl is Rohila. She is form the city of Tursun-zade. Rohila is married and the mother of two children. She lives together with her husband and children. Rohila is a young, likeable and nimble seamstress. She has worked with sewing women's clothing on order for three years.

Rohila requests a loan to purchase building materials for renovating her home. She would like to improve her family's living conditions. For this reason she applied for a loan. Rohila needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating her home

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
Nanie is 51 years old, married, and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. Nanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Nanie has been in the poultry business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Beta

texts.en:
Beta is 54 years old and married has eight children, two of whom are in school. Beta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Beta has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Beta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling palm oil for 4 years, and has managed to get enough income to begin another business of selling cassava flour.

Mariam is married with 8 children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She always dreamed of being financially independent from her husband. She was able to use the previous loan to buy cement and bricks to build her family a house.

Mariam is faced with a challenge of limited capital to sustain her big family and market competition. Mariam is requesting for a loan facility to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is 58 years of age with three children attending school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies. She gets additional income from selling cassava flour in the markets. She started the business to raise income for the family and be in line to pay school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital to satisfy all her needs. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. Maryam has asked for a loan to buy cocoa to sell, which will enable her to raise the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is aged thirty and the mother of two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. After failing to further her studies due to a lack of school fees, she decided to venture into hair dressing and her salon is one frequently sought after by a number of ladies due to her good customer care. She desires to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and also to set up a beauty parlor. Inadequate capital is her major challenge but she is committed to succeed in her business. Kevin is requesting a loan to buy hair braids and weaves for her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and weaves for her salon.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a mother of four living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a stall on a busy street in the market selling fresh foods like ground nuts, beans and tomatoes to her clients and this helps her to get income to support her family. She is a hard working lady and has future plans of expanding her business. She would like to use the loan and invest in buying more foodstuffs to sell to her customers. 

Vick is happy and thinks the only way to live well is through working hard for her family up keep and to expand her business. Vick is requesting a loan to buy food items such as beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy food items such as beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a happily married woman with 6 children. She operates a fresh food stall in Kasese District. Margret also raises livestock and does farming as well to supplement her incomes. Through these sources she has been able to educate her children from good schools and also meet her family developments like buying land. She is a very honest and committed woman who is requesting for a loan to buy more foods like bananas, tomatoes and onions for selling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kamugenyi Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Ednar is a married woman with four children who lives in Kyenjojo. She owns a boutique selling second-hand clothes, having started the business to meet family needs. She gets side income from a salary as a primary school teacher.

Ednar is hardworking and hopes to expand her business but is faced with a challenge of small capital base and high costs of transport moving her clothes to different markets. She intends to use this loan to buy second-hand clothes for sell.

Ednar is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another for a loan. The extra two members in the picture are savers who have guaranteed others but not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen of 38 years is married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Hellen works as a records officer and earns a salary. With the little salary she earns, Hellen is faced with a challenge of raising enough school fees to pay for her children.

Hellen dreams of educating her children to university level. With this loan, Hellen will be able to pay school fees and her children will not be disturbed. She is requesting for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Fauto Bladimir

texts.es:
Fauto, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año bachillerato, está acompañado, tiene 2 hijas, de las cuales solo una estudia, su esposa le apoya con el cuidado del ganado de ordeño.

Fauto, se dedica al cuidado y crianza de ganado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, decidió dedicarse a esto por iniciativa propia y le ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

Fauto, necesita el préstamo para comprar alimento para el ganado de ordeño y mejorar las estructuras de los potreros para el ganado.

Él desea seguir con la crianza de ganado porque actualmente tiene 4 vacas que pronto van a parir.
texts.en:
Fauto, who is 39 years old, studied up to the second year of high school. He is married, and has two daughters, of whom one is currently studying. His wife helps care for their milk cows.

Fauto cares for and raises cattle. He has carried out this activity for some 10 years, having decided to do this on his own initiative. It has allowed him to improve the family's conditions of life.

Fauto needs the loan to purchase feed for his milk cows and to improve the structures on his cow pastures.

He wishes to continue raising cattle since, at present, he has four cows who will soon give birth.

loans.use: purchase feed for his milk cows and improve the structures on his cow pastures.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Group

texts.en:
Vicent is a 35-year-old father of three children and belongs to a male-dominated group. He rents a one-room house in the outskirts of the city. He is a boda boda cyclist where he earns money to support and take care of his household, and he is able to pay school fees for his two children who go to school.

He is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). He is applying for a loan facility of 500,000 UGX. The purpose of the loan is to enable him process a riding permit and also to boost his side income business of farming, thus increasing his profits.

His future plan is to expand his business and also construct a permanent house for his family members. He is a hard working and resilient man who appreciates the support extended to him by Kiva lenders.

Pictured are the group members and the credit officer in charge of the group (extreme left).

loans.use: to pay for and process a riding pemit

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 38 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее есть достаточно развитое хозяйство - 2 коровы, абрикосовый и яблоневый сад. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 15,000 сом (KGS). Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее деятельности, что позволит улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Zamira is 38 and married with four children. She has a diverse farm with two cows and an apple and apricot orchard. Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS.

Zamira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow in order to sell organic milk. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to sell organic milk

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are in school, Shirly works very hard to provide for them.

Shirly runs a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell. Shirly has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Shirly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy Avon products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old, married, and has five children, four of them are in school.

Arlene is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 32000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, nylon rod, etc.

Arlene has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Mouniretou

texts.fr: Mouniretou est une femme mariée habitant à Agoè et qui a trois enfants à sa charge. Agée de 33 ans, Mouniretou est une marchande de produits de beauté qui circule dans les quartiers environnant. Mouniretou fait son approvisionnement quatre fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour acheter des pommades de crèmes, en lait et autres en vue d’en tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leur condition de vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mouniretou is a married woman who lives in Agoè and supports three children. She is 33 years old and sells beauty products, circulating in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Mouniretou purchases supplies four times a month at the market. She is requesting this loan in order to buy beauty creams, lotions, and others in order to make the most profit to be able to meet the needs of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two sets of beauty creams and two sets of lotion.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for welding such as rods, iron, etc.

Imelda has been in this business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, rice, etc. for her food vending business.

Cherry has been in this business for 2 years. Cherry also earns more income from farming vegetables, running a general store, and buying and selling vegetables.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a business direct-selling MSE products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Lydia would like to save enough to secure financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Procy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Procy works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Procy is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase items likes shirts and pants to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like shirts and pants to sell.

loans.name: Dufatanye Sub Group B

texts.en: Aloysie is a group leader. She is 49 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 18 and 22 years. The group is called DUFATANYE, which means “WORK TOGETHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to improve their future. She sells vegetables and has been running a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cabbages,mangoes, and oranges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, mangoes, and oranges for sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a licensed aesthetician who is ready to start her own business. She is starting her business with clientele that she has built for more than 12 years working at various day spas and salons in town.

Her business, Proskincare Solutions, specializes in anti-aging, brow, and clinical treatments. Her biggest challenge has been getting the capital for the initial start-up costs to build out her new space.

Over the course of her career, she has made it a point to address the goals of each individual client. She not only provides relaxation and results, but also an attention to detail that brings them to return to her over and over again. Her clients have often expressed to her how she is the only aesthetician who takes the needed time with them and exceeds their expectations. She has grown her clientele through mostly referrals.

With your Kiva loan, Patricia will be able to follow her dreams and start her own business. The purpose of the loan is to purchase linens, inventory, facial equipment and machines, and office furniture.

She found the perfect location in San Marcos, CA, and once the build-out is complete, she will be ready to see clients in her very own space.

loans.use: to purchase linens, inventory, facial equipment and machines, and office furniture for her aesthetician practice.

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Ana de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus prodcutos durante todo el año en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener una buena cosceha.
texts.en:
Ana, 53, lives in her own home with her husband. She has made a living growing staple grains for the past 20 years. She sells her product throughout the year in surrounding towns and she already has a customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc., so she will have a good crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, a 31-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For the past two years she has operated a general store in the Philippines.

Rosalie has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her direct selling of Avon products.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her food vending business. Virgenia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Virgenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel works in the optical center of a big-box store, cutting and polishing lenses. He has been working there full time for the past six months.

Angel has designed a mobile game, which he is looking to make into an app. He has always been interested in beginning his own business, and is looking to start a business with his new app. He has done all the design work, but needs a developer to create the actual inner workings of the app.

Angel will distinguish his app by making it free and interactive. Money will be earned through options to buy items in the game and advertisements, once the app is downloaded.

Angel will use his Kiva loan to pay the developer to create his app.

He has been attending Southwestern College and studying business administration. His ultimate goal is to start and sell his own clothing line, after he becomes successful with the development of his new app.

loans.use: to pay the developer to create his mobile gaming app.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, adicional a eso tambien posee un molino, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maritza, 30, lives in her own home with her husband and her four children.

She has worked in agriculture for 10 years and she also has a mill. She manages to get ahead with her family with what she earns from her work.

Maritza's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, and other items so she can continue with her job and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is 36 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 11 years now.

Elinita, who has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, has requested a new loan for PHP 20000 to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza, who is 21 years old, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

The recipient of five previous loans from NWTF, all of which have been repaid, Aiza has requested a new one for PHP 20000 to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Generosa has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Wendy Paola

texts.es: Wendy es una joven empresaria que organizó su almacén misceláneo tras el consejo de su madre una comerciante vinculada a las ventas por catálogos que cuenta con una larga trayectoria en esta actividad. En el año 2013 emprendió su proyecto de negocio en su residencia al sur de Barranquilla,  aportando al sector un almacén que les ofrece una gran variedad de artículos uso personal entre ellos lociones, cremas, cosméticos, desodorantes, shampoo y demás. Con esta actividad ha logrado generar ingresos y apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar sin descuidar a su pequeño hijo de un año de edad a quien desea ofrecer una educación de calidad y mayor bienestar. Sus principales clientes son amigos, vecinos y referidos a quienes está dispuesta a recibir, todos los días de la semana en sus instalaciones a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y les ofrece la diversidad de productos que exhibe en su vitrina mostradora. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la comprar nuevos productos; perfumes, lociones, colonias, splash y cosméticos. Esta inversión es muy importante para mejorar el surtido del negocio y con ello incrementar las ventas. Su meta a corto plazo es duplicar sus ventas y aprovechar la temporada de amor y amistad. Su meta familiar es comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young entrepreneur, who set up her store on the advice of her mother—a merchant with many years of experience in the catalogue sales business.

In 2013, she launched her business project at her home, in the south of Barranquilla. She provides the area with a store selling a wide variety of personal products such as lotions, creams, cosmetics, deodorants, shampoos, and the like.

Through this occupation, she has managed to generate an income and help her husband with their household expenses, without neglecting their one-year-old child, to whom she wants to give a good education and a better quality of life.

Her main customers are her friends, neighbours, and referrals, whom she is eager to welcome at her store every day from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. to offer them the range of products that she displays in her showcase.

Currently, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy new products such as perfumes, lotions, colognes, body splashes, and cosmetics.
